loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming garden plants in the Philippines. Elma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies.

Elma has been farming garden plants for 22 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he keeps cows that produce milk to sell and he grows crops. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial problems. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feed. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Lois

texts.en: Lois remembers not being able to pay her children's school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now Lois, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Lois is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give her access to the inputs that can significantly improve his field's soil health.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” expressed Lois.  With this loan, Lois is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double her income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shirts, jeans, sweaters, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Los Pinos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Concepción es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de costura, tejido de busos, compra y venta de queso, venta de carne, compra y venta de ganado, lechería.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Concepción es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ganado; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace tres años con el apoyo de su esposo quien conocía del negocio y le guío a tener un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para mejora de sus herramientas (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en las ferias aledañas a su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LOS PINOS" is beginning its third Pro Mujer loan cycle at the Copacabana social center.  The group comprises eight members and their board of directors is led by the president, Concepción.  The members are involved in different business activities which include sewing, knitting, cheese sales, meat sales, cattle sales, dairy products, etc.

The loan they are requesting will beneft small business owners, including Concepción who has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years.  She joined by invitation during a massive promotion carried out by the institution.  She currently buys and sells cattle.  She started the business three years ago with the support of her husband who was knowledgeable about the business and guided her into having her own independet business.

The loan she is requesting now is to buy more cattle from dealers in the community.  She will raise them and sell them at neighboring trade fairs.  This way of working allows her to generate an income to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the life insurance offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Shoirakhon

texts.ru: Шоирахону 35 лет. Она воспитывает 2 детей. Шоирахон вместе со своей семьей живет в отдаленном регионе. Она занимается бизнесом. Шоирахон продает мужскую одежду на местном рынке. Она занимается этим бизнесом уже более 3 лет.  Ее эффективность помогает ей быть успешной в бизнесе. Она продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет большой круг клиентов. У нее тонкий вкус и она умеет выбрать товар, который имеет большой спрос. Несмотря на все ее достоинства, мощная конкуренция  делового мира, заставляет ее быть внимательным и обновлять товар каждый сезон. Она должна купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США  для покупки товара для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shoirakhon is 35 years old. She is raising two children. Shoirakhon lives in a remote region with her family. She has her own business. Shoirakhon sells men's clothing at the local market. She has been in this business for three years already. Her effectiveness helps her to be successful in the business. 

Shoirakhon sells her goods at the local market and has a large number of customers. She has a fine taste and she is able to select goods that are of high demand. Despite all her advantages, there is intense competition in the business world, which forces her to be careful and change her goods every season. 

Shoirakhon needs to purchase goods for the new season, but does not have sufficient money for this. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 US dollar in order to purchase clothing for the new season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase men's clothing for the new season

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open more business branches within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are in school, Grace works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, toothpaste, etc.

Grace has been in this business for three years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, and toothpaste

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a 28-year-old farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Rahab is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rahab can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Rahab is ambitious and is aiming to reap 50 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, her said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Bilhatu, Ishaya, and  Isuwa. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 39 años de edad casada, madre de tres hijos y trabaja como empleada asalariada.
Ella vive en sacaba distante a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Cochabamba, su trabajo como empleada lo realiza de lunes a sábado y los domingos los dedica a sus hijos.
Rosmery es de estatura mediana, cabellos negros y tez morena, sencilla y muy amable, su especialidad es la cocina; sus hijos esperan con muchas ganas el día domingo porque es cuando les entrega todo su amor deliciosamente cocinado. Su casa es pequeña y muy acogedora. Pero la falta de agua hace que sus hijos tengan que caminar varios kilómetros en busca de este preciado elemento, ella sueña ver todo su esfuerzo reflejado en su vivienda y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua en su hogar.
texts.en: Rosemary is a married woman of 39 who has three children. She is a salaried office worker. She lives 30 minutes away from the city of Cochabamba, where she works in the office from Monday to Saturday. She devotes Sundays to her children. Rosemary is of average build, with black hair and dark skin, is natural and very cheerful and an excellent cook; her children always look forward to Sunday because that when she shows her love for them in the food she prepares. Her house is small and welcoming. But she has no water supply which means that her children have to walk several kilometres to get some of this precious commodity. She dreams of seeing her hard work reflected in her home and to improve her family's quality of life. This is why Rosmery is applying for a loan to install a water supply in her home.

loans.use: To install a water supply in her home

loans.name: Rafkatu

texts.en: Rafkatu is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Rafkatu expressed that she is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Rafkatu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rafkatu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Rafkatu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Rafkatu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what she plans to do with her income from this season, she said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Rafkatu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu remembers not being able to feed  her family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now, Saratu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Saratu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Saratu. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sa'ade

texts.en: Sa'ade is a 35-year-old farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Sa'ade is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sa'ade can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Sa'ade is ambitious and is aiming to reap 55 bags per hectare this season due to the high quality inputs she will obtain as a result of this loan.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Kariniyas, Alfa, and  Priscila. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Maria Rubiela

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Marinilla desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación alimentos como empanadas, pasteles de pollo, buñuelos, entre otros.
Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Maria y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.
Maria desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de una fritadora para reemplazar la que tiene en mal estado y también para la compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas.
Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en: Maria is a modest and hardworking woman who has devoted a large part of her life to looking after her children. She lives in the town of Marinilla where she works spectacularly in the kitchen as her business is preparing food such as pasties, chicken pies and doughnuts, among other things. She sells most of her food to neighbours who know how tasty Maria's food is and they know that they will always get delicious and very we'll prepared food. Maria wants to sell more food and would like to work more comfortably and so she is applying for a loan to buy a deep fat fryer to replace her current one which is in a bad condition. She will also use it to buy supplies to continue preparing her dishes. The loan will enable her to make progress with her business and earn the income she needs to be able to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy a deep fat fryer and supplies for her recipes.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to  buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 28-year-old farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Esther is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Esther can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Esther is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Maryamu is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Maryamu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Maryamu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Maryamu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, she will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Maryamu is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, she will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes she would like to make, she said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Maryamu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Azizakhon

texts.ru: Азизахону 29 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж является строителем. У нее двое детей. Азизахон дома занимается куплей и продажей скотин. Она покупает телят и бычком и после откорма перепродает их. Она зарабатывает на жизнь таким способом. Так как работа мужа является сезонной, зимой муж помогает Азизахону больше. На данный момент Азизахон просит кредит, чтобы купить больше телят и бычков для откорма и продажи, чтобы расширить малый бизнес и получать больше дохода. Азизахон копит деньги на школу и обучения детей, для нее это очень важно. Поддержите Азизахон.
texts.en:
Azizakhon is 29 years old. She is married. Her husband is a carpenter. She has two children. Azizakhon works with animal sales from her home. She purchases calves and bull-calves and after feeding them, she resells them. This way she earns money for living. 

As her husband's work is seasonal, he helps Azizakhon more in the winter. Currently Azizakhon requests a loan in order to purchase more calves and bull-calves to feed and resell, in order to expand her small business and get a larger income. 

Azizakhon is saving money for the education of her children, which is very important to her. Please support Azizakhon.

loans.use: to purchase calves and bull-calves

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru:
Гулистон жительница района Шахритус. Ей 48 лет. Она проживает вместе с мужем и детьми. Гулистон является матерью семерых детей. Она вместе с детьми и мужем занимается растениеводством.
Для Гулистон это работа многое значит. Они этим трудом всей семьей зарабатывают на жизнь. Полученный кредит поможет Гулистон получить хороший урожай и за счет проданного урожая она сможет решить многие свои материальные проблемы. Гулистон будет рада вашей доброте.
texts.en:
Guliston is a resident of the Shahrituz region. She is 48 years old. She lives together with her husband and children. Guliston is the mother of seven children. Together with them and her husband, she works with field crop cultivation. This work means a lot for Guliston. Through this work the whole family earns money for a living. 

The loan helps Guliston receive a good harvest, and from selling it she will be able to solve many of her material problems. Guliston will be glad of your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
Саида жительница района Рудаки. Ей 23 года. Она проживает вместе со свекровью в доме мужа. Саида является матерью троих сыновей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. 
Саида портниха, она занимается шитьем вместе со свекровью для продажи и на заказ. Готовый товар на рынок отправляет ее свекровь. 
Саида берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки, так как ее прежняя швейная машинка поломалась. 
На фотографии Саиды, также прикреплена фотография вышитых ею платьев на продажу.
texts.en:
Saida is a resident of the Rudaki region. She is 23 years old. She lives together with her mother-in-law at her husband's home. Saida is the mother of three children. Her husband is in the Russian Federation as a migrant worker. 

Saida is a seamstress. She works with sewing together with her mother-in-law. They sew for selling and on order. Her mother-in-law sells the finished products at the market. Saida takes a loan in order to purchase a sewing machine, as her previous one is broken. In the photo you see Saida, as well as her embroidered dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells a variety of products. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of flour, sugar, washing soap and other items for her shop. She hopes that in the future, she may have a good life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of flour, sugar, washing soap and other items.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mila works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell nipa roofing business. Mila is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 36 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Angelie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell. Angelie has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Angelie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Grey

texts.es: Grey de 27 años de edad vende comidas preparadas  desde hace 5 años, cuando su madre la encausó pues le ofrecieron un local para que desarrollara su actividad. Como Grey también había trabajado en un restaurante, aprovechó su experiencia y decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios. Hoy tiene un punto de ventas, donde ofrece desayunos y almuerzos, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, de lunes a sábados, comprando en el mercado público de la ciudad, para lograr precios que le permitan ser más competitiva. Su meta mas adelante es lograr tener un local propio y su propia vivienda, porque en la actualidad se encuentra arrendada. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  materia primas e insumos como arroz, aceite, verduras, con un poco mas de disponible comprará mas volumen y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva sea una inversión efectiva.
texts.en: 27-year-old Grey started selling prepared meals 5 years ago, when her mother sued her. She was then offered premises in which to develop her business. Since Grey had already worked in a restaurant, she used her experience and decided to set up her own business venture, she now has a shop, where she serves breakfasts and lunches from 6am until 2 pm, from Monday to Saturday. She buys supplies in the public market in her town because she can get reasonable prices which enable her to be more competitive. Her ambition for the future is to have her own premises and her own home, because she currently has to rent them. She is now applying for a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy raw materials and supplies such as rice, oil and vegetables. If she has a bit more she will buy a greater amount of stock and that is precisely why her Kiva loan will be an effective investment.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies such as milk, oil and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and water.

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en: Leatu remembers not being able to feed her family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. loans.name: Gulru

texts.ru: Гулру благодарит за предыдущий кредит. Она получила большую помощь. Ее жизненные и жилищные условия, в том числе ее семьи улучшилось. Теперь Гулру намерена параллельно заняться разведением мелко рогатого скота у себя дома. Новая деятельность не займет много времени, потому что ей будет помогать семья. Гулру надеется и в этот раз ее поддержат. Она очень признательна Вам.
texts.en:
Gulru is thankful for the previous loan. She received great help. Her and her family's life and living conditions improved. 

Currently Gulru intends to in parallel work with breeding sheep and goats at her home. The new business will not take a lot of time for her, because her family will help her. Gulru hopes you will help her this time too. She is very grateful to you.

loans.use: to start a new business of livestock breeding and purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Hayotkhon

texts.ru: Хаётхон 40 летняя жительница района Пяндж. Она разведена и живет с братом. Развод для каждого человека дается нелегко, но Хаётхон не сломалась. Она нашла в себе силы встать на ноги и продолжить жить. Важную роль в жизни Хаётхон сыграла любовь шитью. Она любила проводить время за швейной машинкой. Время проведенное за швейной машинкой, приносило ей удовольствие и Хаётхон решила совместимость приятное с полезным. Она начала принимать заказы на шитье одежды. В течение 5 лет Хаётхон работает портнихой на дому. Это является ее единственным источником дохода. На данный момент Хаётхон просит кредит, чтобы приобрести новую швейную машинку, потому что старая совсем устарела. Хаётхон заранее благодарит Вас.
texts.en:
Hayotkhon is a 40 years old resident of the Pyandj region. She is divorced and lives with her brother. A divorce is not easy for any person, however Hayotkhon did not break down. She found the strength to stand on her feet and continue living. 

Hayotkhon's love of sewing has played a large role in her life. She loved to spend time by her sewing machine. This time spent by her sewing machine brought her joy, and Hayotkhon decided to combine business with pleasure. She started taking orders to sew clothing. 

Hayotkhon has worked as a seamstress from her home for a period of five years. This is her only source of income. Currently she requests a loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine, because the old one is quite outdated. Hayotkhon thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Abakwatampora Group Kisomoro 11

texts.en: Adolf is a member of Abakwatampora Group Kisomoro 11. He is a hard working man who deals in selling fresh produce. He faces a business challenge of unstable prices but despite this, he hopes to have enough capital for his business and family. He needs a loan to buy fresh produce to sell. In Hofokam groups, members guarantee one another to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy fresh produce to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat for her soup-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy helmets, waterproofs, safely glasses, safety ropes etc.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu remembers not being able to pay school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Maryamu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize, an amount that is more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields thirty bags per hectare, which is double the national average of fourteen. However, Maryamu is ambitious and therefore aiming to reap thirty-five bags per hectare this season. “In five years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” expressed Maryamu. With this loan, Maryamu is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Nyakashema Kwekamba Group

texts.en: Joseph is a fifty-nine-year-old married man with five children, four of whom attend school. Since 2001, he has dealt in tailoring alongside his work in farming in Kagadi, Uganda. His aim is to generate more income for educating his children. He hopes to expand his business despite the challenge of inadequate capital. Joseph is hard working. He is requesting credit to buy more clothes to sell. He is a member of Nyakashema Kwekamba Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobiles to sell and repair equipment.

loans.name: Rompe Corazones Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROMPE CORAZONES” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de api (bebida tradicional), venta de condimentos, taller mecánico, venta de poleras, salón de peinados, servicio de instalación de gas, artesana en mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de condimentos; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó al apoyar a su madre desde niña, ya que ella trabajaba con el mismo negocio, nos comenta que decide independizar su negocio ya que necesita recursos para sus estudios. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de condimentos por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente para financiar sus estudios.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación y de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ROMPE CORAZONES” [Heartbreakers] communal association will stary its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Santiago II center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Ana is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal association have are varied. Among them are: selling food, selling api (a traditional drink), selling seasonings, a mechanic's shop, selling t-shirts, a hair salon, a gas installation service, and hand made blankets.  

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Ana. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling seasonings. She reports that she started this business to help her mother when she was a girl, because her mother worked in the same business. She says she decided to go off on her own because she needs resources for her education.  
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital (buying seasonings wholesale). She will acquire them from wholesale distributors and later sell them in the markets of the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate resources to finance her education. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings and the health care the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy seasonings wholesale.

loans.name: Khoken (A) Group

texts.en:
Vahneichong is a resident of New Keithelmanbi, which is about 40 kilometres from Imphal. She is one of the members of Khoken (A) Group. Vahneichong is 40 years old and a mother of four children. To supplement her household income, Vahneichong and her husband cultivate pineapple in the village. They plant more than 8,000 pineapples on their farm. When it gets ripe, they take the pineapple in the bi-weekly market and sell it for 20-30 INR each. With the little profit they get from the business, they maintain the household expenses and the children’s educational expenditures.

Vahneichong says she and her husband work very hard to raise their children to get decent jobs and achieve what they want to become in life. All of her children are in pre-secondary school and they are brilliant, says Vahneichong with a smile. The power supply in her village is very irregular and her school-going children cannot study properly after sunset.

To overcome this, she has to use alternative lighting devices such as candles or buy kerosene oil for the lantern. Now she wants a Kiva solar loan, which will help her to buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system that will light four bulbs for 12 hours a day. Since it has a 90-meter-long wire, it can be installed in any of the four adjacent rooms in the house. She believes that because of the solar power, her children will be able to study comfortably in the evening and after sunset and she can do her household chores in a bright light. She is so happy and thanks Kiva for the generosity towards her and the group.

The rest of the team members need mini solar systems too for their income-generating purposes and for their household use.

loans.use: To buy a mini solar home lighting system so that her children can study after sunset.

loans.name: Evergreen Group

texts.en:
Sinthui, a middle-aged woman with the raised hand, is the featured member of this group from Reangzeang village in Bishnupur district of Manipur. She lives with her husband and her school-going son and daughter. By profession, she is a vegetable vendor and sustains her family with her meagre income while her husband cultivates potato, yam, corn, peas, ginger. Some days she makes profit from selling vegetables like corn,ginger, potato, cabbage, cauliflower, mustard leaves, chilli,bamboo shoot, etc. and other times she loses. Their family income is approximately 150,000 Indian rupees per month. Her husband works as a manual labourer during off-season and also helps his wife transport the vegetables to be sold from her home to market place.

Looking for a better future and improvement of her financial conditions, the featured member decided to expand her business by selling more varieties of vegetables. She has already availed herself of two loan cycles, and this will be her third cycle of loans. She holds a good record of repaying her previous loans.

The group Evergreen was formed by women with a common interest in getting a loan. Most of them are vegetable vendors, and some are weavers of traditional shawls. The loan will help them to upgrade their businesses and gradually improve their financial conditions.

loans.use: To buy chive seeds and ginger saplings for farming

loans.name: Heydi Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora  Heydi  de  27 años de edad  es casada y vive en su casa de habitación  con sus hijos cuenta con su negocio el cual es la elaboración y venta de alfarería, donde elabora lo que son  jarros,  joyeros,  gallos de barro, plato, picheles  y una gran variedad en adornos.
Doña Heydi es conocida  por ser una persona luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante, está muy contenta con el apoyo que se le ha brindado, en otras ocasiones ya que con las ganancias ha mejorado su taller de alfarería,  vive en aldea al sur de Honduras.
 Doña Heydi solicitando el préstamo para la compra de adornos, jarrones, platos, picheles ya elaborados para la revenderlos y con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Su sueño es   terminar de construir su local.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Julio 2014
texts.en:
Heydi is 27 years old. She is married and lives in her house with her children. She has a business which is making and selling pottery. She makes jugs, jewelry boxes, clay roosters, plates, pitchers and a wide variety of decorations. 

Heydi is known for being a fighter who wants to get ahead. She is very happy with the support that has been given her on other occasions, because the profits have improved her pottery shop. She lives in a town in southern Honduras. Heydi is asking for the loan to buy decorations, vases, plates, and pitchers that have already been made to re-sell them. With the help of this loan, she hopes to improve her income and be able to keep supporting her family.

Her dream is to finish building her locale.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: to buy decorations, vases, plates, and pitchers for her business.

loans.name: Juan Neptali

texts.es:
Juan tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con la mamá en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC CEVALLOS , se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco. Pertenece a la parroquia San Juan de Pueblo viejo se dedican a labores afrícolas.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la siembra y asi aumentar la produccion. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

 El sueño es seguir mejorando en los cultivos.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y las enfermedades en los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan is 20 years old. He is single, has no children, and lives with his mother in canton Ventanas in Provincia de los Ríos. He is a member of VRC CEVALLOS, located in Recinto San Francisco.

He belongs to the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish, dedicated to agricultural labor. Juan works in agriculture, planting corn and soy.

He requests this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for planting and increase production. He will make his purchases in Ventanas.

His dream is to continue improving his cultivation. The challenges he faces are competition and crop diseases. 

In his free time, he likes to practice sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Omaira Maria

texts.es:
Omaira una mujer que como muchas adquirió sus conocimientos de su negocio gracias a sus padres, se dedica a la producción y distribución de arepas, actividad que aprendió desde muy joven y ya hace 20 años tomo el negocio familiar y a sus 40 años de edad lo mantiene.
Quiere comenzar a formalizar mejor la empresa pues nunca había tenido la ayuda de una entidad que le facilitara dinero para engrandecer su empresa y para ello quiere un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de una motocicleta con lo que generara un empleo , la usara para la distribución de sus arepas, también quiere comprar un molino electrónico para reducir esfuerzo y tiempo de producción el resto lo invertía en surtido para fabricar un mayor número de arepas diarias pues ya tiene como distribuirlas.
Su gran sueño es ver crecer su negocio e hijos
texts.en:
Omaira is a woman who, like many, acquired her business knowledge thanks to her parents. She makes a living producing and selling arepas, an activity she learned when she was very young. She took over the family business twenty years ago, and now at 40 years old, she maintains it. 

She wants to begin to better formalize the business, since she had never had the help of an entity to provide money to grow her business. She wants a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of a motorcycle with which she will generate work. She will use it to distribute her arepas. 

She also wants to buy an electric grinder to reduce the time and effort of production. The rest she would invest in supplies to make a greater number of areas daily, since she would have a way to distribute them.

Her greatest dream is to see her business and her children grow.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle, an electric grinder and corn.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is a 39-year-old farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Shehu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Shehu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Shehu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 100 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Shehu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Zakariya,  and  Nuhu. Shehu’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy traditional Eritrean wedding clothes for her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es una mujer trabajadora de 30 años de edad, Soltera, tiene un hijo varón, quienes viven en el departamento de Sololá. La actividad productiva es diseño y elaboración de ropa típica (cortes, blusas entre otros) en diferentes estilos y colores, es una actividad rentable, la experiencia lo obtuvo de su hermana, lleva ocho años en el negocio, su mercado meta son las personas que utilizan el traje en las comunidades vecinas, así obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos para sostener a su familia y brindarle lo necesario para su bienestar. Está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la compra de dos telares y poder elaborar más trajes típicos e incrementar sus ventas. La meta es lograr ver a sus hijos graduados, además enseñarles a elaborar este tipo de trajes típicos para que ellos puedan emprender su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia is a hardworking woman of 30. She is single and has a son. They live in the department of Sololá. To earn her living Antonia designs and makes local clothing (dresses, blouses etc) in different styles and colours. It is a profitable business. She learned her skills from her sister and has had the business for eight years. Her customers are those who wear these garments in nearby communities. Her majority of her income is used to support her family and buy whatever is necessary for their wellbeing.

Antonia is seeking a loan of Q10,000 to buy two looms so she can make traditional outfits and increase sales. Her dream is to see her children graduate and teach them how to make traditional clothing so that they too can have their own business.

loans.use: Buy tools and supplies to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a 26 year old farmer from Chiroma. As a Babban Gona member, Jonathan is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Jonathan can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Jonathan is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Jonathan said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland, in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Jonathan is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en: Rabi is a 50-year-old farmer from Kiyawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Rabi is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rabi can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Rabi is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Nasiru, Ya'U, and  Nafisa. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Dinora Eugenia

texts.es: Dinora tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas de 19 años, 14 años y 8 años de edad. Dinora se gana la vida por medio de la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza mucho por llevar el sustento a su hogar.  Dinora solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de su vivienda para el cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera y pines.
texts.en: Dinora is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and three daughters aged 19, 14, and 8. Dinora has earned her living as a maid for many years. She is a hardworking woman who makes a great effort to support the household. She is seeking a loan from FUSAI as she wishes to repair the roof of her house. She needs to buy materials such as galvanized sheets, wood, and pine beams

loans.use: Buy galvanized sheets, wood, and pine beams to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 24-year-old single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail store where he sells grains. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in Kanyakwar, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the 25,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional grains, including maize and beans, for the store. His business goal is to improve and develop his store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional grains, including maize and beans, for the store

loans.name: Jescah

texts.en:
Jescah is a 52-year-old single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a grocery and cereal business where she sells cereals, maize, sukuma wiki, avocados and tomatoes. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional stock of maize and other groceries for her store. Her business goal is to be a grocery and maize supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business and educate her children to the highest level. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of maize and other groceries for her store

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en: Boaz is a 43-year-old married man with nine children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer, and faces challenges of limited capital and unpredictable weather changes. Besides that, he has hopes of completing his semi permanent house. Boaz needs a loan to harvest his maize.

loans.use: to harvest his maize

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a business where she sells tomatoes, fish, and mangoes. Her primary customers are regular ones. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season. 

Rosemary will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more mangoes. Her business goal is to be the best within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will raise her living standard.. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy stock and shelving for her clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pure water, cigarettes and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food containers, cups, and knives to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings expand her business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan es un agricultor que ha ejercido su profesión a lo largo de su vida, brindando productos saludables y sanos para el consumo de las personas. 
A sus 22 años edad se ha trazado una meta de poder crear una familia, tener unos hijos para alegrar su hogar y sabe que para traer hijos al mundo hay que tener con que mantenerlos por esa razón quiere mejorar su negocio, aumentar su productividad y asegurarse un futuro en base a trabajo en el campo.
Por esta  razón solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le permita aumentar y tener mayor productividad, el crédito lo invertirá en fertilizantes, abonos y semillas con los que quiere comenzar una nueva era en sus cultivos una más productiva y beneficiosa.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer, and has been all his life, providing people with healthy and safe food. 

The 22-year-old has set himself the goal of being able to create a family, to have children to brighten his home, and knows that to bring children into the world it is necessary to have the means to support them. 

For that reason he wants to improve his business, increase productivity and ensure a future for himself based on working in the countryside.

Therefore, he is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies that allow him to grow his business and have greater productivity. The loan will be invested in fertilizers, manure and seeds with which he wants to start a new era in his farming - an era which is more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Tijani

texts.en: Tijani remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Tijani, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Tijani  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 60 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Tijani   With this loan, Tijani is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough frozen chicken, bread, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more petroleum jelly (orie) and hot rub to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods like candy and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Mohammadu

texts.en: Mohammadu is a Babban Gona farmer from Kiyawa. Mohammadu expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Mohammadu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Mohammadu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Mohammadu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 60 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Mohammadu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Mohammadu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a Babban Gona farmer from Gwagwamawa. Isah expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Isah to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isah can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Isah is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Isah will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre, hermana y cuatro sobrino de 8 años, 11 años, 17 años y 15 años de edad. Walter trabaja como albañil desde hace 12 años lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Él desea reparar el techo de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder tener accesos a este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la reparación de la vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Walter, 36, lives in his own house with his mother, his sister, and four nieces and nephews, ages 8, 11, 17, and 15.

He has worked in construction for 12 years, which allows him to support his household.

Walter wants to repair the roof of his house, so he's asking FUSAI for this loan to buy galvanized metal, wood, and nails.  He hopes to be able to get this loan so he can start repairing his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal, wood, and nails to repair his roof

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive con su conyugue y sus dos menores hijos de 21 y 7 años de edad de los cuales el ultimo cursa primaria en colegio nacional de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado caprino, las ventas lo realiza en el mercado de su distrito, su esposo trabaja en una mototaxi brindando servicio de transporte público, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado caprino para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Laura is 44 years old. she lives in her own house constructed of rustic materials with her spouse and her two children aged 21 and 7 years old. The youngest attends primary school at the Colegio Nacional de Pucará. Pucará is located in the Province of Jaén, which belongs to Cajamarca Region in the North Andes of Peru. It is a community with a hot climate whose people work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Laura works raising and selling goats. Her sales are made in the district market. Her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver providing public transportation. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 PEN to buy goats to fatten them and later sell them at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale at a higher price.

loans.name: Kyanyambubi Farmers Group

texts.en:
Scovia is a 46-year-old married woman living in  Masindi, Uganda. She is responsible for taking care of four children between 6 and 20 years. 

She grows sugarcane and sells seeds from a nursery bed for extra income. She started business so as to earn a living. She dreams of having a healthy family and expanding her business. Weather changes and fire out-breaks in her fields affect her business.

She wants a loan to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a Babban Gona farmer from Kiyawa. Deborah is driven by one goal: to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” It is this ambition that led Deborah to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Deborah can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Deborah is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 45 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, she will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Deborah is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, she will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes she would like to make, she said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family.  Ultimately, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, Deborah will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sale Wanzan

texts.en: Sale Wanzan is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Sale Wanzan joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Aminu, Shamsiya, and  Abdurrahman. Sale Wanzan is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Sale Wanzan will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Sale Wanzan can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Sale Wanzan is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Crisosto

texts.es:
Crisosto tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y dos hijos menores, en Callayuc, una comunidad de clima frío su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la carpintería, talla sillas, mesas, bancos, puertas entre otros, comercializándolo en los caseríos de su distrito, es un padre emprendedor que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un equipo para realizar acabados en sus trabajos y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Crisosto is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Callayuc, a community with cold weather located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region, a mountainous area in northern Peru. Its population is involved in agriculture, livestock, and trade.
Crisosto makes his living with carpentry, carving chairs, tables, benches, doors, etc, and selling them in the villages of the district. He is an entrepreneurial father who makes a real effort in his work. He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles for the purchase of equipment to apply finish to his pieces and thus provide a better service, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy equipment to help with his work.

loans.name: Dalgy

texts.es: Dalgy se dedic a la elaboración y venta de hayacas, postres, a la venta de queso y de mercancia variada; con estas cuatro actividades,  genera todos sus ingresos con la cual busca lograr cada vez mas un mejor bienestar. Ella aprendió a elaborar alimentos de manera empirica y con eso justamente  ha logrado sostener sus gastos. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y sobre pedidos. Dalgy tiene precios competitivos, porque compra en el mercado público y directamente a almacenes mayoristas. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y familiares, le remiten permanetemente nuevos clientes y esto hace que su capital de trabajo sea insuficiente para lograr respuestas oportunas. Esta es la razón por la acual acude a un credikiva, primer fiancamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará por una parte insumos para elaborar sus hayacas y postres y por la otra parte invertirá en mercancia variada comp ropa. Con su credikiva tendrá mas liquidéz para comprar y generará mayor producción e impulsara sus ventas y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Dalgy makes a living preparing and selling hayacas [stuffed cornmeal pastries] and desserts, as well as selling cheese and various merchandise. Through these four activities she generates all her income, with which she seeks to achieve increased well-being.

She learned to prepare foods from experience, thus being able to manage her expenses. She sells on a made-to-order, cash basis.

Dalgy offers competitive prices, because she buys from the public market and directly from wholesalers. Her clients are her neighbors and family. They are constantly referring new customers to her, and this results in her capital on hand being insufficient to respond appropiately. 

This is the reason why she is requesting a loan [credikiva], the first loan she's taking from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to buy supplies to prepare her hayacas and desserts, on one side, and on the other to invest in various merchandise such as clothing items.

With her loan she'll have more cash in hand for purchases, and she will increase her production, and boost sales. This will be precisely the success of her investment.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make her pastries and desserts, on one side, and on the other to invest in various merchandise such a clothing items.

texts.es: Paul tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 14 años y 4 años de edad. Paul trabaja como jornalero en una finca cercana a su localidad desde hace mucho tiempo. Paul solcita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado.  Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Paul is 35 years old and lives in the house he owns together with his life partner and their two children who are 14 and 4 years old.  Paul has worked as a laborer on a nearby farm in his town for a long time.  

Paul is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal sheeting and wood to repair the roof of his home since it has deteriorated.  He hopes to count on this loan and start the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting and wood to repair the roof of his home.
