loans.name: Hilda Gloria

texts.es: Doña Hilda es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, muchos ánimos y esperanzas de salir adelante y de cumplir lo propuesto en su vida manifestando a sus 56 años la gratitud y el respeto primeramente a DIOS por darle la vida y muchas bendiciones a diario y posteriormente hacia sus padres por haber inculcado en ella valores y principios. Ella es madre de 4 hijos quienes participan en la asistencia y mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café. Desde hace varios años practica la agricultura ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaran dicha actividad y hoy en día sigue ejerciendo en compañía de su familia. Los cultivos que juntos asisten son propios ubicados en su misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan caminando mismos que fueron heredados por su padre. Doña Hilda tiene un grado de estudio de primaria incompleto cursando únicamente hasta su cuarto año ya que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar. Ella tiene como meta seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café de manera que puedan generar mayores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia apoyándola en todo lo necesario y demás que ellos necesiten. Por lo que doña Hilda hoy en día solicita financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas, etc. y pagando mano de obra para llevar a cabo un mejor mantenimiento y tecnificación de la misma.
texts.en:
Hilda is a woman with a lot of strength, energy, and hope of getting ahead.  She wants to fulfill the purpose in her 56 years of life.  She gives gratitude and respect to God for giving her life and many blessings every day.  She also thanks her parents for teaching her values and principles.  

She is the mother of four children who help care for and maintain her coffee crops.  She has been a farmer for many years, since her parents taught her that work, and she continues to do it together with her family.  She inherited her land from her parents, so her crops are located in the same community where many others have walked.  Hilda attended primary school for four years, but did not finish because of a lack of financial resources.  

Her goal is to continue expanding her coffee crops so that she can generate more profits to improve her family's quality of life and support them with everything they need and more.  Hilda is requesting this loan in order to improve her crops by giving them better care by applying items like manure, fertilizer, coffee fertilizer, and fungicides.  She also will pay laborers to have better and more modern maintenance of her crops.

loans.use: to pay for farming supplies and to pay laborers for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Las Hermanas De Gran Puni Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS HERMANAS DE GRAN PUNI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante se derivan de la pesca de diferentes especies de peces, misma que la realizan en el Lago Titicaca.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pesca; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia hace cuando se casó, ya que anteriormente apoyaba a su familia en el mismo negocio, tenia el conocimiento suficiente para la implementación de este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra redes) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.

Una de las socias no estuvo presente en la imagen, ya que por motivos de viaje se retiro rápidamente.
texts.en:
“LAS HERMANAS DE GRAN PUNI” Communal Bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Regional Office. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Sra. Alicia is president. The members run businesses derived from fishing different species of fish in Lake Titicaca.

The loan they took out will help small business owners such as Sra. Alicia. She notes that this is the first time that she has been a member of Pro Mujer and that she joined at the invitation of a Pro Mujer recruiter, who visited her at her home. She reveals that she currently owns a fishing business she started when she married and that formerly she supported her family in the same trade. She had sufficient knowledge, therefore, to start her current business.

The loan she will take out now is for food during the dry season (she buys nets) that she will acquire from sellers in the city of El Alto and will later use  at her sales venue. This kind of work enables her to generate resources to support her family since she lives in a common law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the life insurance offered by the institution. 

One of the members does not appear in the photo because she was away on a trip.

loans.use: to purchase nets.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a 30-year-old farmer from Kiyawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Dauda is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dauda can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Dauda is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Manasseh, Phibi, and  Esther. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Jamila, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Jamila  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Jamila   With this loan, Jamila is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, cigarettes, biscuits, and general stock to sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa familiar junto con su hijo de 25 años en el Distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas de estación, bebidas gaseosa, refrescos en un caserío cercano a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos como gaseosas y bebidas refrescantes y de esta manera abastecer y atender a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sara is 43 years old. She lives in the family home with her 25 year old son in the Pucará district, a community with a hot climate whose inhabitants  engage in farming, trade and stock raising. It is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Perú.

Sara sells seasonal fruit, sodas and soft drinks in a village near her district. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of S/.500 in order to purchase a greater quantity of products, such as sodas and soft drinks, and in this way stock her business and provide for her customers so that she will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of fruit to stock her business.

loans.name: Alh.

texts.en: Alh is a 55-year-old farmer from Ang./Karofi. As a Babban Gona member, Alh is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Alh can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alh is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Alh said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland. In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, Alh is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Zakiru Maigugu

texts.en: Zakiru Maigugu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Zakiru Maigugu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Madansir , and Muntari,. Zakiru Maigugu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Zakiru Maigugu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Zakiru Maigugu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Zakiru Maigugu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria quiere ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes para que le compren sus productos naturales, pero tiene un gran desafio y es el de tener suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr invertir en volumen. Su experiencia data de hace 30 años, en los cuales tiene como clientes a los visitantes del centro de la ciudad; ella está ubicada en el sector mas comercial de la ciudad. Su meta es tener un local de mayor tamaño y su propósito mas importante respecto a su mercadoc es incrementar su número de sus clientes. Maria vende diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y cuenta con una clientela que cada dia solicita productos, como alcanfor, sábila, y en general plantas medicinales. Maria es separada y madre de 9 hijos que se encuentran en las edades de 12 a 31 años y aun espera producir mucho mas, para generar bienestar en su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicano a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará alcanfor, sábila plantas, medicinales etc. Con ello su oferta crecerá, ofrecerá mejores precios y nuevos productos, con los cuales  aumentar una vez mas sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria wishes to offer her customers better prices so they can purchase her natural products, but she has a great challenge and that is to have sufficient working capital to be able to invest in volume. Her experience dates back some 30 years, during which she has had customers who visited the center of the city. She is located in the city's most commercial sector. 

Maria's goal is to have a larger shop and her most important proposal with respect to her business is to increase the number of her customers. Maria sells daily from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm and she can count on a clientele that daily solicits products, such as camphor, aloe vera, and medicinal plants in general. Maria is separated and the mother of 9 children between the ages of 12 and 31. And she still hopes to produce many more, to generate wellbeing in her home. 

At present, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, enabling her to purchase camphor, aloe vera plants, medicinal products, etc. With this, her inventory will grow and she can offer better prices and new products, helping sales to increase.

loans.use: buy camphor, aloe vera plants, and medicinal products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cerdos y patos en un corral posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Teresa, age 35, lives with her children in the Cayaltí district.  This community devotes itself to agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  It is in the Chiclayo province, which is in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises small animals like pigs and ducks in a pen behind her house.  She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,500 soles in order to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals.  This way she will generate greater earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals.

loans.name: Halisu

texts.en: Halisu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Halisu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Naziru, Kabiru, and  Nasiru. Halisu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Halisu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба замужняя женщина. Ее муж занимается растениеводством. У них двое маленьких детей, мальчик и девочка. Махбубе 34 года. Она с семьей живет на районе Пяндж. 
  3 года назад Махбуба вышла на работу в качестве портнихи. Она с юности умела шить. Ее мама была умелой швеей и Махбуба унаследовала ее талант. Махбуба надеется весь свой опыт передать своей дочери. 
  Махбуба несколько лет работала с одной швейной машинкой. Машинка устарела и ей необходимо купить новую, но из-за финансового положения семьи ей не удается самостоятельно реализовать покупку. И Махбуба обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a married woman. Her husband practices crop farming. They have two small children - a little boy and a little girl. Mahbuba is 34 years old. She lives with her family in the Pyandj District.

Three years ago, Mahbuba went to work as a seamstress. She has known how to sew since childhood. Her mother was a talented seamstress and Mahbuba inherited her talent. Mahbuba hopes to pass down all of her work experience to her daughter.

Mahbuba has worked for several years with one sewing machine. Her machine has become outdated and she needs to buy a new one. Hoever, due to the financial situation of her family, she is unable to successfully make this purchase on her own. This is why Mahbuba is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del amor un lugar de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha, este Cantón es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, a disfrutar de sus maravillosas cascadas, sitios de descanso y su maravillosa flora y fauna silvestre. 
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el seños José un hombre luchador de 50 años él es padre soltero tiene 5 hijos a los cuales tuvo que criar solo ya que se separó de su conviviente y ellos quedaron a su cuidado, él se dedica al negocio de la producción de carbón, gracias a este negocio pudo salir adelante junto con sus hijos lleva dedicado a este negocio 20 años, diariamente trabaja unas 8 horas, aprendió de este negocio en su niñez junto con los padres, el viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y tubo que luchar muy duro para salir adelante 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en la vivienda para mejorar su nivel de vida, el señor José agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, the canton of love, is a place with a warm, humid climate full of friendly, hardworking people. It is located in the northwest of Pichincha Province. This canton is often visited by national and foreign tourists who come to enjoy its marvelous waterfalls, rest places and its marvelous native flora and fauna.

Sr. José lives and has his business in this canton. He is a determined 50 year old man. He is a single father with 5 children, whom he had to raise alone since he separated from his partner and they remained under his care.

He produces charcoal and thanks to this business he was able to get ahead with his children. He has had this business for 20 years and works every day for some 8 hours. He learned the business from his parents during his childhood. He comes from a family of scarce resources and had to struggle very hard to survive.

He is requesting this loan to invest in his dwelling in order to improve his standard of living. Sr. Jose is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and opportunities they have provided.

loans.use: to improve his house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a trade business where he sells wet cell batteries. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of wet cell batteries. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he may provide stability for his family and expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of wet cell batteries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastic and general stock to expand her business.

loans.name: Hafizu

texts.en: Hafizu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Hafizu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children; Naziru, Majittafa,  and  Usumanu. Hafizu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Hafizu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Hafizu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Hafizu said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland”. Hafizu is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Abdulkadiri

texts.en: Abdulkadiri is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Abdulkadiri joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: . Abdulkadiri is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Abdulkadiri will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Abdulkadiri can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Abdulkadiri is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Nacia Maritza

texts.es:
Nacia de 31 años de edad,  ha estudiado licenciatura en psicología. Desde hace varios años es empleada de una empresa como coordinadora de proyectos, su  horario es de 8:00 am a 4:00 PM.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar medicinas para su mamá. 

El objetivo de Nacia es siempre seguir trabajando y ayudarle a su madre en los gastos,y siempre cancelar al día sus cuotas.
texts.en: Nacia is 31 years old and studied for a license in psychology. For some years she has been employed in a business as a project coordinator. Her schedule is 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. The loan that she is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy medicine for her mother. Nacia's goal is to always keep working and to help her mother with her expenses and to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her mother.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Bazaroy

texts.ru: Базарой добрая и вежливая женщина. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У Базарой большая и дружная семья, состоящая из его мужа детей и внуков. С их семье цениться взаимопонимания, дипломатичность и уважение к другим, что особенно важно для большой семьи как они. Семья Базарой живет на районе Кубадиён. Содержать большую семью тяжело и Базарой решила внести свой вклад в семейный бюджет. Она будет дома заниматься животноводством. Ей будет помогать вся семья. Но для начала бизнес ей необходимы средства, на которые она будет покупать телят и бычков. Из-за того что у нее не хватает денег она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Bazaroy is a kind and happy woman. She is 46 years old and married. Bazaroy has a large and close-knit family consisting of her husband, their children and their grandchildren. Their family values mutual understanding, diplomacy and respect for one another, which is especially important for such a large family. Bazaroy's family lives in the Qubadiyon District. To support a large family is difficult, so Bazaroy decided to make her own contribution to the family budget. She is going to practice livestock breeding at her home. Her whole family will help her with this. However, she needs a certain amount of money to start this business and use to buy calves and bull calves. Because she does not have enough money for this, she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to start her new business and buy calves.

loans.name: Diolmer

texts.es:
Diolmer tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y compra de animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Diolmer is 27 years old and lives with his parents in the district of Buenos Aires which is a community that works in agriculture, trade and livestock, and has a hot climate. It is located in the Morropon Province within the Lambayque Region on the north coast of Peru. 

He buys and raises small animals in his backyard. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to buy feed to fatten up the animals. With this, he will be able to earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten up small farm animals.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Un hijo se enfrenta a un gran reto el cual es no vivir acosta de sus padres y este es un fantasma que ha perseguido al señor Julio quien desde muy joven aprendió la actividad de publicista gracias a conocimientos estudiantiles y a su padre que le enseño todo acerca del negocio, trabaja básicamente como intermediario y desea independizarse y mostrar que tiene todas las facultades para superar lo que en vida su padre realizo y tiene todo por delante pues a sus 23 años de edad es una persona muy experimentada gracias a tantos días acompañando a su padre con el negocio. 
Solicita un crédito para adecuar, decorar y formalizar una empresa donde atenderá sus clientes formalizando más su negocio y viendo más serio y llamativo para sus clientes. 
Su sueño es poder duplicar sus ingresos en un periodo de 3 años.
texts.en:
A child is faced with a great burden when he does not live at his parent's expense and this challenge that has plagued Julio, who, from very young, learned to be a publicist due to his scholarly learning. Also, his father taught him everything about business. He works basically as an intermediary and was to become independent and show that he has all the skills to make a better life that than that of his father. 

He has everything ahead of him and, at the age of 23, he is a very experienced person thanks to the many days he spent working with his father at his business. He is requesting this loan to improve, decorate and professionalize a business where he will attend to his clients. Making his business appear more professional will make it more attractive and seem more serious to his clients. His dream is to double his earnings in a three year period.

loans.use: to improve, decorate and make his office more professional.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, a bag of rice, a gallon of oil, etc.

loans.name: Mikaila

texts.en: Mikaila remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Mikaila, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Mikaila  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” expressed Mikaila   With this loan, Mikaila is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Kasimu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 80 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Kasimu   With this loan, Kasimu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes, pure water, biscuits and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Osman Abdul

texts.en: "I am Osman and a student at the Central University College, studying Christian Education. Prior to this loan facility, I was paying my fees through personal savings and the assistance from my brothers. Christian education interests me so much because it enables me understand the Bible very well and explain it to others as well. The family and I will benefit through the understanding of the scriptures and do the will of the God I will also teach other people in my community the word of God. The word of God inspires me because I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me; simply the word of God guides and directs me. Without this loan I will not be able to complete my education as planned and will have to go out of school and look for job to earn income and pay for my tuition fees. I want to thank the investors for their support and ask God to bless them in all that they do.”

loans.use: To pay tuition fees

loans.name: Henrry

texts.es:
Henrry es un joven muy emprendedor y desde siempre había querido ser independiente económicamente para generar sus propios ingresos y tener una vida más estable.
Por eso compro un taller montallantas en el que trabajaba como empleado desde hace un tiempo y aunque todavía esta pagándolo, se siente muy satisfecho y entusiasmado de saber que pronto podrá cubrir su sueño.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de mano que le hacen falta para su trabajo y compra de algunos insumos y repuestos para vehículo.
Con esto podrá seguir prestando su servicio y continuara cultivando unos frutos de progreso que más adelante le darán esa vida soñada.
texts.en:
Henrry is a very enterprising youth and he has always wanted to be economically independent, to generate his own income and to have a more stable life. For this reason, he bought a tire shop where he had worked as an employee for some time. Although he is still making payments, he feels very satisfied and enthusiastic to know that soon he will achieve his dream. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of hand tools that he needs to do his job and some other supplies and spare car parts. With this he will be able to continue providing services and cultivate the fruits of progress that soon provide him with the life he has dreamed about.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гулжамал - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Гулжамал занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулжамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец, а также есть земельный надел размером 4,0 ГА, на котором Гулжамал ежегодно выращивает: фасоль и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход Гулжамал составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжамал обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) с целью использования кредита на покупку нетели и на полевые работы. Доходы от кредита Гулжамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Gulzhamal is 55 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Gulzhamal has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Gulzhamal practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 23 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulzhamal's hard work, she currently has 2 dairy cows and 10 sheep on her farm, as well as a 4.0 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows beans and perennial grasses. Gulzhamal's average monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business, Gulzhamal turneds to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy heifers and to till her land. Gulzhamal plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also wants to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy heifers and till her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en: Salisu remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Salisu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Salisu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Salisu   With this loan, Salisu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla is 28 years old, a clothes seller and a married woman with a child. Her husband is a clothes seller, too. They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $15 per day. Now Phalla would like to apply for a loan of $1,500 to buy more clothes to resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she wants to expand her business, build her own house and support her child to go to university.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: 02 Thắng Tây,ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

She is 31 years old and married with one child. Thu is the group leader of the 02 Thắng Tây,ngư Lộc Group solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2013, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thu has been involved in this business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios, age 48, buys and sells pigs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns approximately PhP 13,000 per month. She lives with her husband and their four children in Catagan, Tangub City.
  
Remedios has been a member of PMPC for three years and is thankful for the financial help that the cooperative has extended to her. Currently, Remedios is almost to the point of completing the fencing around their house, and she has applied a loan to to pay for labor on finishing the fencing.

In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for labor to complete the fencing around her family home

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a 34-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Analiza's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her agriculture business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Analiza is taking out a PHP 9714 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Analiza has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mea Jiezel

texts.en:
Mea Jiezel is 28 years old with two children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Mea Jiezel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mea Jiezel has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Mea Jiezel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 44 years old. Lida is married and has two children who are in school.

Lida and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Lida is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 6533 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Lida has been with NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help, Lida can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Turdubu

texts.ru: Турдубу 66 лет, замужем, мать 7 детей. Образование-среднее. С 1973 года Турдубу занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, благодяря ее большому опыту и неустанному труду, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Турдубу есть 1 дойная корова, 1 нетель, 3 лошади, 10 овец и 1 бычок. Для содержания скота есть все условия,  летом скот отгоняется на пастбище, зимой содержится в сараях. Также Турдубу вместе со своей семьей выращивает на 1 ГА собственной поливной земли лук, кукурузу и клевер для собственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход семьи составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турдубу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец для увеличения поголовья скота с целью дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Турдубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Turdubu is 66 years old, married and a mother to seven children. She has a secondary education. Turdubu has been practicing agriculture, namely livestock breeding and crop farming, since 1973. Thanks to her lengthy work experience and relentless hard work, Turdubu currently has 1 dairy cow, 1 heifer, 3 horses, 10 sheep and 1 bull calf on her farm. She has all of the necessary conditions for housing livestock. In the summer, she send them out to pasture and in the winter, she houses them in her barns. Together with her family, Turdubu also has a 1.0 hectare irrigated plot of land on which she grows onions, corn and clover for personal consumption and sale. The family's average monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Turdubu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy calves and sheep to increase the size of her herd, with the goal of reselling them in the future. Turdubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business and the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves and sheep.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Desde muy niña a Eliana le ha gustado el tema comercial, por eso cuando sintió la necesidad de generar ingresos encontró en la venta de ropa, una oportunidad de trabajar de manera autonoma.  En su portafolio cualquier cliente encuentra cremas, perfumes, calzado, y ropa engeneral que puede comprar mediante un crédito a 15 dias. Ella compra especialmente paquetes promocionales a sus proveedores , que ofrece a estudiantes de la universidad, quienes son su mayor mercado. Su meta es vender mucho mas y a futuro adquirir un vehiculo que le proporcione mas comodidad para hacer su trabajo comercial. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comrpará ropa, calzado, colonia, con el fin de maximizar sus ingresos. Con esta inversión planea aumentar sus ganancias y diversificar mucho mas, lo cual es el éxito de su inversión mediante un credikiva.
texts.en: Since she was very young Eliana liked the commercial business. Therefore, when she felt she needed to produce income, she found an opportunity to work independently by selling clothes. Among her products, her customers will find creams, perfumes, shoes and clothing that they can buy on credit to pay in 15 days. She specially buys promotional packages from her providers, which she offers to college students who are her main market. Her goal is to sell much more and in the future buy a vehicle that will give her more comfort to sell her merchandise. Currently, she is applying to a credikiva, the first loan she has from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy clothes, shoes, cologne, so that she can maximize her earnings. With this loan she plans to increase her income and diversify much more, which is the success of her investment through a credikiva.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cologne.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, and milk to expand her bread business.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province, Khem is 32 years old and married. She has one baby daughter. To make a living, she and her husband have been working as garment workers and sometimes they work as paid construction workers. Together, they can earn about 11,000 KHR per day and save about 5,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

This is Khem’s fist microloan with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for a motorbike for her family to use. She hopes to have a decent motorbike to commute.

loans.use: to pay for a motorbike for her family to use to commute

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem, 39, is a married mother living in a rural village of Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is a hard-working farmer who grows rice and raises pigs. Having been in this business for 21 years, she is able to earn about 46,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is Nem’s first microloan with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy bean seeds for growing in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds for growing in order to earn additional income for her family.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en: Basiru remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Basiru, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Basiru  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” expressed Basiru   With this loan, Basiru is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sokhy Group

texts.en: Sokhy is 26 years old, a farmer and a married woman with two children, one of whom is a student. Her husband is a farmer, too. They live in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Both of them can earn approximately $16 per day. Now, Sokhy would like to apply for a loan of 810,000 Riels as a group of three members, and she will use her portion to buy foundation parts for a latrine. This loan will help her live in better conditions. In the future, she wants to expand her cultivation, build a bigger a house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts for a latrine.

loans.name: Vecheka

texts.en: Vecheka is a 21-year-old student in Phnom Penh. He lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Due to a lack of financial support, he would like to apply for a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he is going to find a good job to help his family.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en: Sopheak is 21 years old, a student at Cambodia Asia Institute who lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Due to a lack of financial support, she would like to apply for a loan to pay her tuition fee. This loan will help her get a higher education. In the future, Sopheak wants to have a good job or a business and a bigger house and to support her children to finish university.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Chantha Group

texts.en: Chantha is a 34-year-old farmer, and a married man with three children. All of his children are students. His wife is also a farmer. They live in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Both of them can earn approximately $20 per day. Now he would like to request a loan of 1,350,000 KHR as a group of five members, and he will use his portion to build a new latrine. This loan will help him live in better conditions. In the future, he is going to buy more farmland, build a new house, and support his children to finish high school.

loans.use: to build a new latrine.

loans.name: Ederlyn

texts.en:
Ederlyn is married with two children and manages a flower garden with her husband. She also has a retail store from which she earns better income for  the family. 

She joined GDMPC (Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative) and borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides to ensure better farm produce to sell. She plans to expand the farm and wants to improve the general living of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en: Suzette resides in the village of Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, with her family. Her husband works in the government while she runs a retail business selling ready-to-wear clothes, bags and shoes to make a living. She joined Gata Daku MPC  and took out a loan to buy additional goods to sell. She hopes to gain more income to use in expanding her business. She also wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina has been operating their own farm to make a living. For many long years in farming, her ability was improving and she gained a better income for the family.

Her previous loan used for farming has been repaid successfully. Finding ways to improve their farm becomes easier with her access to GDMPC. She took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and for farm maintenance.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and for farm maintenance

loans.name: Danh

texts.en: Danh is a 45-year-old married man. He lives with two children and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. For 17 years, he has run a business providing haircut services for people in his community. Danh would like a loan to purchase better quality equipment and tools for haircutting. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that with this loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality equipment and tools for haircutting

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 47 лет, замужем,мать 5 детей (1 сын и 4 дочери). С 1989 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, на тот момент родители супруга выделили молодой семье Эльмиры 1 корову, 1 теленка и 10 овец. Прошло много лет, Эльмира смогла развить свое хозяйство и полеводческую деятельность - на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 1 лошадь, 4 дойные коровы и 23 овцы, а также есть земельный надел, на котором Эльмира ежегодно выращивает картофель, кукурузу и клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эльмира обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для дальнейшей их перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве, а также на улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Elmira is 47 years old, married, and a mother to five children (1 son and 4 daughters). She has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming since 1989. At that point in time, her husband's parents gave Elmira's young family 1 cow, 1 calf and 10 sheep. Many year have gone by and Elmira has managed to develop her agricultural business. She currently has 1 horse, 4 dairy cows, and 23 sheep on her farm as well as a plot of land on which she annually grows potatoes, corn and clover. For the purpose of the further development of her business, Elmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy calves to future resale. Elmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock as well as the improvement of her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 44 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for four years.

Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, a generator and fabric.

loans.name: Chhat's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Chhat is 47 years old and married. She is a mother of who two kids, who strives for a living via rice cropping on 1.5 hectare of farmland and her paid-work job. The current business earns her about 35,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day after engaging in the current business for several years. 

This is the first microloan for Chhat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She teams up a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for a plowing fee. She strongly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en: Inusa remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Inusa, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Inusa  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Inusa   With this loan, Inusa is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, two of whom are in school, Leonila works hard to support her family.

She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Leonila is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Feliser

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Feliser works hard to support his family.

He has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Feliser is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy more sacks of coconut shells and charcoal for his business.

Feliser has been sustaining his business activities through his past 12 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconut shells and charcoal for his business.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Luciano works hard to support his family. He has a tobacco and corn farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Luciano is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for his tobacco and corn farming business.

Luciano has been sustaining his business activities through his past 12 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to purchase a vehicle for his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kulnar

texts.ru: Кульнар 58 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Кульнар в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 31 год назад с 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кульнар, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 15 овец и 1 лошадь, также есть земельный надел мерою 3,25 ГА, где Кульнар выращивает ячмень и эспарцет. Ежемячный доход составляет примерно 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кульнар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 бычка и овец. Доходы от кредита Кульнар планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и хочет закончить ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kulnar is 58 years old, married, and has two children. Kulnar's work with livestock and farming is the primary source of income for her family. She started 31 years ago with 30,000 KGS. Because of Kulnar's hard work, her farm now has two cows, fifteen sheep, one horse, and a 3.25 hectare plot of land where Kulnar grows barley and sainfoin. Her monthly income is about 9,000 KGS. In order to further develop her business, Kulnar asked the bank Bai Tushum for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy a calf and sheep. Kulnar plans to invest profits from the loan into further expanding the business and finishing renovations on her house.

loans.use: buy sheep and a calf.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en: Umaru is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Umaru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Abdulhadi, Sagiru, and  Ashiru. Umaru is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Umaru will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Umaru can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Umaru is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a 30-year-old farmer from Barau.  As a Babban Gona member, Haruna, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Haruna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Haruna is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 100 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Haruna is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Asa,  and  Amina. Haruna’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca de 31 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos 2 de 12 años y uno de 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida de la venta de productos básicos en su vivienda, además elabora tostadas de plátano todos los días desde hace 9 años lo que le sirve como un ingreso extra para la economía familiar y el estudio de sus hijos, su esposo apoya económicamente con su trabajo de jornalero. Blanca desea mejorar el piso del patio de su vivienda ya que este es de tierra como se observa en la fotografía lo que provoca insalubridad para su familia por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava y pagar mano de obra para encementar el piso del patio de su vivienda.
texts.en: Blanca is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their three children, two of whom are 12 years old and one of whom is 14 years old. She is a entrepreneurial woman that makes a living selling basic products out of her home. She has also made fried bananas everyday for 9 years which brings in extra income for her family and goes toward her children's schooling. Her husband brings in income as a day laborer. Blanca would like to fix the floor of the patio in her home which, as you can see in the photo, is currently made of dirt and causes health problems for her family. She is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, and to pay for labor to lay the cement on her patio.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and to pay for labor to lay the cement on the patio of her home.

loans.name: Josepine

texts.en: Josepine is married with two children, and lives in Zamboanga del Norte with her family. Her husband works as a government employee, while she is engaged with her hog raising business to earn a living. She’s successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC used to cover the costs of motorcycle repairs and maintenance. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase feeds and other supplies. Her dream is to see her children finish their education, and with their hope and determination, success is at hand.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 44 года,замужем, мать 3 детей, образование среднее. Эльмира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1999 года занимается швейным делом. Стартовав с 4,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль от 30,000 сом (KGS) до 40,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку новых швейных машин, так как она хочет расширить свой бизнес и нанять швей-надомниц. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и мечтает приобрести квартиру в городе.
texts.en: Elmira is 44 years old, married, and a mother to three children. She has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Elmira has been running a sewing business since 1999. Starting this business with 4,000 (KGS), she currently has an income of 30,000 som (KGS) to 40,000 som (KGS) per month. For the further development of her business, Elmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy new sewing machines, as she wants to expand her business and hire a seamstress to work in her home. Elmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business. She also dreams of buying an apartment in the city.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is 26 years old and is living with her husband and one child in a rural village in the Damabe district.

Rice farming is the only main source for her family’s income and she has been farming rice for 8 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 16,000 KHR, but she is able to save 7,000 KHR each day.

This is the second loan for Touch with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beer, stout, soft drinks and similar goods

loans.name: Toeng's Group

texts.en:
Toeng is 55 years old and widowed. She lives with four children in a rural area located in the Srey Snom district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice in the local area. The current business earns her family about 33,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day to feed the family but she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day.

This is the fourth loan for Toeng with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and plow her field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plow her field.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm material such as cutlass hooks

loans.name: Isolina Del Rosario

texts.es:
Isolina del Rosario tiene 47 años de edad de estado civil soltero, vive en el Distrito de Morropon, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas frente al mercado de su Distrito, actividad que realiza hace más de 03 años, contando con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno para posteriormente ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isolina del Rosario is 47 years old and single. She lives in the Morropon District. It is a place where its inhabitants make a living from agriculture, livestock, and commerce. They count on basic services like water and power. It is situated in the Province of the same name that belongs to the Piura Region on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living from the sale of red meat in front of her district’s market, an activity that she has performed for more than 3 years. She counts on regular customers. She has requested a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of cattle to later offer to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Kulpat

texts.ru: Кульпат 45 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. У Кульпат среднее образование, с 1989 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, на 2,40 ГА поливной земли ежегодно выращивает фасоль и клевер, также есть свое хозяйство. В хозяйстве у Кульпат имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, 1 лошадь, 1 жеребенок и 20 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и полеводства Кульпат обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 53,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и ГСМ для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Кульпат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве, а также хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Kulpat is 45 years old, married and has 4 children.  Kulpat had received a high school education and from 1989 she has been growing crops and raising livestock.  To date, she has been successful at growing beans and clover on a 2.4 hectares of land.  In addition, she also has one milk cow with calf, one horse, a foal, and 20 sheep.  Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to grow her business, Kulpat has turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 53,000 som (KGS) to purchase fertilized and additional land for cultivation.  Profits from her business, Kulpat is planning to invest into getting more livestock and to save some for her son's wedding ceremony.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул - лидер группы "Жоогазын", также в группе состоят еще 2 человека. Бурул 38 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У Бурул  среднее образование, свою трудовую деятельнрость она начинала с работы в швейном цеху, сейчас работает санитаркой в больнице. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Бурул с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бурул, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 1 дойную корову, 1 лошадь, 3 теленка, 8 овец и 5 коз. Также есть 1,50 ГА поливной земли, где Бурул выращивает картофель, клевер и фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки теленка, а также для закупки минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а в ближайшем будущем дать своим детям достойное образование.
texts.en: Burul is the leader of the group "Zhoogazyn." There are also two other members in the group. Burul is 38 years old, married, and is raising three children. Burul has a secondary education. She started her career working in a sewing shop. Now she works as a cleaning woman in a hospital. As an additional source of income for her family, Burul has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 2000 with initial start-up capital in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Burul's hard work, she currently has 1 dairy cow, 1 horse, 2 calves, 8 sheep and 5 goats on her farm. She also has a 1.50 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes, clover and beans. For the further development of her business, Burul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to increase her number of cattle by buying a calf. She also wants to buy mineral fertilizers. Burul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also wants to give her children a good education in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a calf and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en: Lawan remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Lawan, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Lawan  is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Lawan   With this loan, Lawan is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad de 33 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida desde hace 18 años vendiendo pescado y cangrejos de manera ambulante,además presta sus servicios domésticos en un rancho, su compañero de vida apoya económicamente con su trabajo de jornalero en su cantón. Trinidad desea terminar de construir su vivienda lo antes posible ya que como se observa en la fotografía algunas de sus paredes son de paja y esto provoca inseguridad e insalubridad a su familia. Es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para poder terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Trinidad is 33 years old and lives with her life partner and her two children, a 2-year-old and a 8-year-old. She is an entrepreneurial woman that has earned a living for 18 years selling fish and crab as a street vendor. She also does domestic chores at a ranch. Her life partner works as a day laborer in their region to help financially. Trinidad would like to finish contruction on her house as soon as possible since, as you can see in the photo, some of the walls are made of straw which in not secure nor healthy for her family. Because of this, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized flooring, wood and nails to be able to finish building her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized flooring, wood and nails to be able to finish building her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his brother's education.

loans.name: Tereseta

texts.en:
Tereseta is 60 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Tereseta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for 40 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods to sell, including bagged rice.

loans.name: Ernie

texts.en: Ernie, has been growing and harvesting corn to sell in town and has had this business for many years. This is the primary source of income for the family. Ernie took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. He joined GDMPC this current year and he gains access to micro finance services of the cooperative. Ernie is planning to expand his farm, hoping it will flourish and enable him to improve his children's lives.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and organic pesticides

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 46, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Pablo, a driver and they have children. She, together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Virginia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Virginia dreams to that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her family a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell. Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business. Glory has been in this business for 4 years. Glory earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон 53 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У Чолпон среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 16 лет назад с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 1 корову, 10 овец и 1,60ГА земли, где Чолпон  выращивает картофель, клевер и фасоль. Бизнес в целом приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS)в месяц, что уже позволило ей построить дом.  Чолпон - участник группы "Жоогазын", кроме нее членами группы являются еще два человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки  нетели и минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а в ближайшем будущем - построить большой сарай.
texts.en: Cholpon is 53 years old, married and has three children. Cholpon has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 16 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Cholpon's hard work, she currently has 1 cow and 10 sheep on her farm, as well as a 1.60 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes, clover and beans. This business brings in about 6,000 som (KGS) each month, which has already allowed her to build a house. Cholpon is a member of the group "Zoogazyn." Besides her, there are two other members in the group. For the further development of her business, Cholpon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to increase her number of cattle by buying a calf and mineral fertilizers. Cholpon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to build a large barn in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a calf and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods like rice, oil, cubes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy enough goods (dry fish) to sell.

loans.name: Doris Maria

texts.es:
La señora Doris es una agricultora muy habilidosa con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.
Tiene unos cultivos de pasto, plátano, maíz que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Adicionalmente tiene ganado y cría de pollos, es una mujer integral y muy trabajadora.
Actualmente vive con su esposo y sus hijos por las cuales ha tratado de luchar siempre para sacarlos adelante.
Ella desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este, por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios y semillas de pasto e insumos para preparación de su tierra, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener unos productos de mejor calidad.
Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y brindarles a sus hijos un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Doris is a very skilled farmer with experience in various areas of agriculture, with an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind.

She has some grass, banana, and corn crops that she tends every day from the very early hours of the morning. Additionally, she has livestock and raises chickens. She is a very well-rounded and very hardworking woman.

Currently, she lives with her husband and her children for whom she has tried to always fight to bring out ahead.

She wishes to give her crops a push and make a better income from these. For this, she is requesting economic help to invest in agricultural supplies, pasture seed, and supplies for the preparation of her land. The loan will give her the opportunity to have some better-quality products. 

Her greatest dream is to have her own home and to provide a good future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, pasture seed, and supplies for the preparation of her land.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Sochea is a 38-year-old mother of six children and earns a living through farming rice, while her husband works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for twenty years and the current business earns her about USD $16 per day to feed the family.

Sochea is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Rabeka

texts.en:
Rabeka remembers not being able to feed her family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. 

Now Rabeka, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000 this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, which is double the national average of 14. However, Rabeka  is ambitious and aims to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. 

Rabeka requests a loan in order to buy fertilizers and seeds, which will enable her to double her income and yield.
