“In five years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” Rabeka says. "With this loan, I am well on my way to achieving  this dream."

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds in order to double her income and yield.

loans.name: Christian Orlando

texts.es:
Christian Orlando tiene 18 años de edad, vive en casa familiar en el Distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Christian Orlando is 18 years old. He lives in his family home in the Purcará District, a community that makes a living from agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is situated in the Jaén Province that belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He makes a living from the sale of general groceries. His business is located in his home. He has requested a loan of 1,500 Nuevo Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of a larger quantity of merchandise to offer to his customers and in this way generate a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to supply his business.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en: Ishaya remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Ishaya, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ishaya  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” expressed Ishaya. With this loan, Ishaya is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: to access high quality supplies such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu remembers not being able to feed her family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now,  Salamatu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Salamatu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” expressed Salamatu. With this loan, Salamatu is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high quality supplies such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu remembers not being able to feed her family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now,  Maryamu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Maryamu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs,” expressed Maryamu. With this loan, Maryamu is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: to access high quality supplies such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 6 Group

texts.en:
Benita is the coordinator of her group, Unidas para Triunfar (Unite to Win) 6, located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. She is the mother of three children and makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner.

Benita is excited to be taking out her seventh loan with Esperanza and by the opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her miscellaneous products business, selling clothes, cosmetics, shoes, etc. Benita will use this loan to increase her inventory. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to support her family’s needs. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other miscellaneous products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goods such as spoons, pens, and glasses.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркуль 23 года, замужем, 2 детей. Образование среднее, на протяжении 5 лет разводит скот и занимается полеводством. Бизнес в сфере животноводства был начат с 5,000 сом (KGS). Супруг Анаркуль помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркуль, на сегодняшний день она имеет в хозяйстве: 1 дойную корову, 1 теленка и 45 овец. Также в наличии имеется 2,00 ГА орошаемой земли, на которой Анаркуль ежегодно сажает фасоль и клевер. Урожай клевера используют в качестве корма скоту, фасоль реализуют. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркуль обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 25 овец. Доходы от кредита Анаркуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, а также постройку сарая.
texts.en: Anarkul is 23 years old, married and has two children. She has a secondary education. For the past five years, she has been raising cattle and practicing crop farming. She started this livestock raising business with 5,000 som (KGS). Anarkul's husband helps her with her farm. Thanks to Anarkul's hard work, she currently has 1 dairy cow, 1 calf and 45 sheep on her farm. She also has a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she annual sows beans and clover. She uses her clover harvest as feed for her cattle and her bean harvest for selling.  Her average monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Anarkul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy 25 sheep. Anarkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also wants to build a barn.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Magira

texts.ru: Магира, 29 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Магира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур, стартовав в 2006 году с суммы в  7,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Магиры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 2 теленка и 15 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,20 ГА, где Магира со своей семьей выращивают картофель, фасоль и многолетние травы. Магира является одним из трех членов группы "Жоогазын".  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Магира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ГСМ для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Магира вложит в покупку кошары и  бытовой техники для дома.
texts.en: Magira is 29 years old, married and has three children. As the main source of income for her family, Magira practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 2006 with 7,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Magira's hard work, she currently has 1 cow, 2 calves and 15 sheep on her farm, as well as a 1.20 hectare plot of land on which she and her family grow potatoes, beans and perennial grasses. Magira is one of three members of the group "Zhoogazyn." To further develop her business, Magira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 30,000 som (KGS) to buy fuel, oil and lubricants for cultivating the land. Magira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the purchase of a sheep shed and household appliances.

loans.use: to buy fuel, oil and lubricants for cultivating the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers to sell

loans.name: Tala

texts.en: Tala remembers not being able to feed her family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now Tala, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Tala is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” expressed Tala. With this loan, Tala is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, Vita (beverage), and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carton of soap.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Wilmar Humberto

texts.es:
Hace 10 años de inicio la historia del señor Wilmar quien monto su propio negocio de Carpintería actividad que aprendió gracias a sus años de trabajo como ayudante de carpintería vio la posibilidad de montar su negocio y comenzó, agradece mucho a la virgen y a Dios por que le ha ido muy bien y ha podido generar buenos recursos para mantener a su familia y darle gusto a su hijo de 8 años de edad, pues por su dura infancia en donde paso por necesidades y se vio obligado a trabajar desde muy le ha servido para trabajar y ser consiente que su hijo no debe pasar por esta situación.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de un taladro y una taladora la cual son herramientas indispensables para su profesión, su principal sueño es crecer y crecer y darle la oportunidad a jóvenes necesitados de trabajar y generar sus propios recursos.
texts.en:
Señor Wilmar started his own carpentry business 10 years ago, having learned this occupation through years of work as a carpenter’s apprentice. He saw that it was possible to set up his business, and he began. 

He is very grateful to the Virgin and to God, because it has gone very well for him, and he has been able to make a good living, supporting his family and giving his 8-year-old son a happy life.  His childhood was hard; he did without, and he had to work at a very young age. This has served him in his work and in taking care that his son not be subjected to such a situation.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a drill and a rotary tool, which are indispensable tools for his profession. His biggest dream is to grow and grow, and to give disadvantaged young persons the opportunity to work and generate their own resources.

loans.use: to purchase a drill and a rotary tool.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bricks, cement and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Óscar de 19 años de edad vive con su madre de 42 años de edad. Él es un joven muy emprendedor que se gana la vida como jornalero en una hacienda de lunes a viernes, además en su afán por mejorar sus condiciones de vida cultiva maíz el cual vende al salir la cosecha. Su madre lo apoya en la economía familiar prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. Óscar desea construir un baño y una pila para recoger agua por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo, hierro, grava, arena y pagará mano de obra para que le construyan el baño y la pila.
texts.en: Óscar is 19 years old and lives with his mother who is 42. He is an enterprising young man who makes a living as a day laborer at a nearby hacienda Mondays-Fridays. He also has an interest in improving his living conditions by growing corn, which he sells during the harvest season. His mother helps him with household expenses by working as a maid. Oscar wants to continue constructing a bathroom and a sink to collect water in. And so, he is applying for a loan with FUSAI in order to purchase brick, iron, gravel, sand and to pay for labor.

loans.use: purchase bricks, iron, gravel, sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, Vita (beverage), and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as beer, stout, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his brother’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's college tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new chair and generator and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es: Santos de 32 años de edad vive con su hermano en casa propia. Él es reconocido por ser un hombre muy trabajador que se gana la vida como jornalero en una hacienda local desde hace 15 años, además tratando de mejorar sus ingresos siembra maíz y plátano el cual vende al salir la cosecha. Santos desea construir un cuarto en su propiedad para proteger mejor sus pocas pertenencias por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y pagar mano de obra para la construcción de un cuarto en su propiedad.
texts.en: Santos is 32 years old and lives with his brother. He is known for being a hard working man who makes a living as a day laborer at a nearby hacienda. He has worked there for 15 years and he supplements his income by growing corn and plantains that he sells during the harvest season. Santos wants to build a room on his property to protect the few belonging that he owns. And so, he is asking for a loan with FUSAI in order to purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel and to pay for labor.

loans.use: purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods such as water, oil, salt, seasonings, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy rice and oil to sell.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: Diego es una personas de 48 años de edad, Casado, quien tiene tres hijos, dos varones y una mujer, quienes viven en el departamento de Sololá. Actualmente se dedica al trabajo de jornalero en actividades productivas como en mantenimiento y cosecha de café, lleva dos años realizando este tipo de trabajo, del cual obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de un lote de terreno. La meta a es pode darles a sus hijos un lote de terreno para que ellos logren construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Diego is 48 years old and he is married with three children, two boys and a girl, who live in the department of Sololá.  He works for daily wages in productive activities such as tending and harvesting coffee.  He has been doing this type of work for two years, from which he earns his monthly income in order to provide for his family. 

He is seeking a loan of 6,000 Quetzals in order to purchase a plot of land. The goal is to be able to give his children a plot of land so that they will be able to build a home of their own.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare car parts and renovate his workplace .

loans.name: Jhunior Javier

texts.es: Javier tiene 29 años de edad y vive con su compañera de vida. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida como jornalero de una hacienda de lunes a sábado por las mañanas y también los sábados por la tarde vende los cangrejos que recoge, también su compañera de vida lo apoya en la economía familiar vendiendo antojitos típicos por las tardes. Javier desea reparar el techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones actualmente, además necesita hacer algunas reparaciones a las paredes de la misma las cuales están hechas de paja como se puede observar en la fotografía por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para hacer las reparaciones en el techo y paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en: Javier is 29 years old and lives with his wife. He is an enterprising man who makes a living as a day laborer at a nearby hacienda Mondays-Saturday in the mornings and also in the afternoon on Saturday. In the afternoon, he sells the crabs that he catches. He wife also helps him to support the family by selling traditional snacks in the afternoons. Javier wants to repair the rood of his house that is currently in poor condition. He also needs to make repairs to the walls of his home because they are made of straw, as you can see in the picture. He is applying for a loan with FUSAI so he can purchase galvanizes steel, nails and wood in order to make repairs to the roof and to the walls of his home.

loans.use: purchase galvanized metal sheets, nails and wood.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 67 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en el sector de La Viña, una zona rural del Distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos.
texts.en:
Juana is 67 years old and lives with her husband in the La Viña sector, a rural zone in the district of Cayalti. Cayalti is in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The people of Cayalti make a living in agriculture, raising livestock, and business. 

Juana has been raising and selling animals for several years. Her business is located in the back of her home. She has requested this loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,500 Peruvian soles in order to buy animal feed to fatten her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Cecilia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Cecilia Esmeralda tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a sus 3 hijos, en el Distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cecilia Esmeralda, 33, lives with her three children in the district of Oyotún. The local people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. This district is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Cecilia Esmeralda has made a living selling groceries, such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, and vegetable stew, for several years. Her business is located in her home. She has applied for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian new soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a larger quantity of products to stock her business and serve her clients.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José  de 27 años de edad solo estudio hasta 7° debido a la situación económica.

 Está acompañado, su esposa realiza los oficios del hogar. Tienen dos niñas, junto con él además vive su madre.


José  inicio a trabajar desde la edad de 15 años en la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de su padre. Además, aprendió el oficio de estructuras metálicas, gracias a un amigo, de estas dos actividades que realiza, es de donde obtiene ingresos para mantener a su familia.

 
El crédito será invertido para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, etc.  y de esta manera poder realizar la siembra de maíz.
 
	
El sueño de José, es mejorar su vivienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José  is 27 years old and he went to school up to the 7th grade.
He is married and his wife takes care of the home. They have two daughters and they live together, along with his mother. 
José began working in agriculture when he was 15 years old, a trade he learned from his father. He also learned about metal structures from a friend of his. These two activities are how he earns money to support his family. 
The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides etc. so he can grow corn. 
His dream is to improve his home and to give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a generator and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура жительница Яванского района. Она замужем. Ей 35 лет. Манзура является матерью шестерых детей. Она проживает вместе с мужем и детьми. Манзура имеет среднее образование. Она очень трудолюбивая и честная. 
Манзура берет кредит в размере $1000 с целью приобрести высококачественные семена овощей и минеральные удобрения для повторного посева. Она в первые работает с Хумо и очень ждет вашей поддержки.
texts.en: Manzura lives in the Yavan region.  She is 35 years old and she is married with six children.  She lives with her husband and children.  Manzura has a high school education.  She is very hard-working and honest.  Manzura is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy high-quality vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizer for her second sowing.  She is a first-time borrower with Humo and she is awaiting your support.

loans.use: to buy high-quality seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Ситоре 33 года. Она жена и мать двоих детей. Ситора с семьей проживает в маленьком районе Пяндж. Ситора 1 назад начала новую деятельность, шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она научилась шить давно. Ее научила ее мама. Ситора в течение года продвигает свою деятельность и старается помочь мужу обеспечить семью и улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Но на данный момент Ситора не приносит доход в семью, причина является сломанная швейная машинка. Она не в состоянии самостоятельно совершить покупку и обратилась за кредитом. На заемные деньги она приобретет желаемую машинку и восстановит источник дохода.
texts.en: Sitora is 33 years old. She is a wife and a mother of two children. Sitora and her family live in a small district of Pyandj. Sitora started a new business in sewing women's clothing to-order one year ago. She learned how to sew a long time ago from her mother. Sitora has been developing her business over the course of a year, trying to help her husband to provide for the family and improve the family's financial condition. Currently, Sitora is not bringing in an income for the family due to a broken sewing machine. She is unable to make the purchase independently and requested this loan. She will use this loan to buy a desired sewing machine and restore her source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal and wood to make a new roof for her home.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар трудолюбивая женщина. Она заботливая мать 5 детей. Раньше она не работала, так как ее муж обеспечивал их, но 5 лет назад у ее мужа возникли проблемы с бизнесом, и Санобар была вынуждена начать свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она уже более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Этим бизнесом она зарабатывает на жизнь. С полученного дохода она выдала замуж своих дочерей. Санобар данное время нуждается новой швейной машинке, так как ее швейная машинка сломалась. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sanobar is a hardworking woman. She is a caring mother of 5 children. Previously, she did not work because her husband provided for her, but her husband ran into problems with his business 5 years ago, forcing Sanobar to start her own business in sewing women's clothing. She has been providing seamstress services for over 5 years and earns a living with this business. She used the resulting income to marry off her daughters. At the present time, Sanobar needs a new sewing machine because her sewing machine broke down. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Edilfredo

texts.es:
Edilfredo tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad tranquila con clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente de manera artesanal mediante “El trapiche”, actividad que consiste en extraer el jugo de la caña para posteriormente hervirlo y purificarlo, obteniendo así la bebida conocida como el aguardiente o llonque.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad d caña que es materia prima de su producto.
texts.en:
Edilfredo, 35, lives in the district of Callayuc. It is a calm community with a varied climate. The local people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. This district is located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Edilfredo makes a living distilling aguardiente using a traditional method called "El trapiche". This method consists of extracting sugarcane juice and then boiling and purifying it, thereby making the liquor called aguardiente or llonque.

He has applied for a loan of 2,500 Peruvian new soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a larger quantity of sugarcane, the raw material for his business.

loans.use: to buy sugarcane to stock his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough supplies for baking

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора добродушная женщина. Она живет в отдаленном регионе вместе со своей семьей. Нигора разведена и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Двое из них несовершеннолетние. Она единственная кормилица своих детей. Нигора занимается собственным бизнесом. Она откармливает скот. В основном она откармливает мелко-рогатого скота. Она данное время имеет 6 голов мелко-рогатого скота. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом развевать бизнес и получить больше дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки 10 голов мелко-рогатого скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nigora is a kind woman. She lives in a remote district together with her family. Nigora is divorced and raising 3 children, two of whom are underage. She is the sole provider for her children. Nigora is involved in her own business. She fattens up livestock, primarily small livestock. At the present time, she has 6 heads of small livestock. She wants to increase her working capital in order to develop her business and earn more income. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy 10 heads of small livestock. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy 10 heads of small livestock in order to develop her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the installation of electric energy for her home.

loans.name: Asulvi

texts.ru: Ее зовут Асулви. Ей 55 лет. Асулви замужняя женщина и мать семерых детей. Она умелая швея и мастер своего дела. Асулви берет заказы на шитье занавесок и штор. Данной деятельностью она занята уже 10 лет. Асулви знает все тонкости и секреты своей работы. С годами приходит опыт и соответственно количество клиентов с годами растет. И Асулви чтобы сохранить клиентов увеличивает ассортимент предлагаемых видов штор. Для этого она просит кредит, Асулви на часть кредита приобретет ткани и другие принадлежности. На другую часть она отремонтирует дом. Асулви давно мечтала сделать ремонт и сейчас у нее есть хорошая возможность. Асулви заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en: Her name is Asulvi and she is 55 years old. Asulvi is a married woman and a mother of seven children. She is a skillful seamstress and a master of her trade. Asulvi takes commissions to make curtains. She worked as a seamstress for 10 years now. Asulvi knows all the details and secrets of her work. Years of work bring experience and her number of clients steadily grows. In order to keep her clients Asulvi would like to expanded the inventory of curtains she can offer. For this purpose she would like to request a loan so she can buy fabrics and other supplies. The remaining sum of the loan she will spend to repaid her home. Asulvi has dreamed to repair her home for a while and now she has a good opportunity. Asulvi is in advance grateful for your help.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for curtains and for home repairs

loans.name: Zokir

texts.ru: Зокир живет вместе семьей среди высоких гор Таджикистана. Он очень заботливый человек. Зокир женат и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Он занимается скотоводством уже более 7 лет. Зокир откармливает крупно-рогатого скота несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Он имеет хорошую возможность для развития бизнеса скотоводством. Его опыт и индивидуальный подход позволяют ему развевать бизнес. Его жена и отец помогает ему откармливанию скота. Зокир также занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки 4 голов крупно-рогатого скота для увеличения оборотного капитала. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zokir lives with his family in the high mountains of Tajikistan. He is a very caring man. Zokir is married and is raising two young children. He has been raising livestock for 7 years now. Zokir feeds cattle for a few months and sells them at the meat market. His experience and individual approach to customers allows him to steadily develop his business. He also grows various crops. His wife and his father assist with caring for the animals. Zokir now has a good opportunity to expand his livestock business. He is requesting 10,000 somoni to purchase four cows and increase his cash flow. Zokir hopes for your kindness and charity.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams, fasteners and galvanized metal sheets to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара родилась в 1986 году. Она предприниматель. Гулсара занимается купле продажей женского белья 6 лет назад, так как она нуждалась в деньгах. Ее муж подрабатывает на стройках и его доход маленький. Гулсара покупает оптом из центрального рынка и реализует в розницу. Гулсара имеет торговую точку на местном рынке. Она всегда старается обновлять ассортимент товара и таким образом привлечь покупателей. Гулсара запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки женского белья увеличения ассортимента товара. Она планирует с полученной выгоды улучшить качество жизни и инвестировать образование детей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulsara was born in 1986. She is an entrepreneur and has been selling women's lingerie for 6 years now. She started he business because she was in need of additional money, as her husband is a part-time construction worker and has a small salary. Gulsara buys lingerie wholesale at the central markets and sells at her local one. She has a market stall at the local market. She always tries to offer new items for sale and attract new costumers. Gulsara is requesting 4,000 somoni to purchase women's lingerie so she can expand her inventory. She plans to use the profits to improve her family's quality of life and save for her children's education. Gulsara is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy women's lingerie and increase cash flow

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is married and works hard to support her family by buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 25,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for five years and her goal for the future is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for four years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, that is, oil, rice, salt, peppers, etc

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba works hard to support her family. Melba is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net.

Melba has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Melba would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Edwin Ramiro

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del amor un lugar de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora este Cantón es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de sus maravillosas cascadas y sitios de descanso en este cantón en un pequeño recinto llamado San Juan de Puerto Quito vive el señor Edwin un hombre luchador de 33 años, es soltero vive en casa de los papas de una anterior relación tiene una hija de 7 años por la que día a día lucha y se supera 
El señor Edwin solicita el crédito para invertir en el inicio de su propio negocio una granja de cerdos el viene de una familia de bajos recursos que siempre se dedicaron a la agricultura y ganadería y gracias a eso el tubo la oportunidad de aprender lo necesario sobre la crianza de cerdos y también aprendió mientras estudiaba, por experiencia propia sabe que a este negocio se le dedica un promedio de 4 horas por día.  
Con esta inversión mejorara su nivel de vida y podrá seguir aportando a la a educación y preparación de su hija, el señor Edwin agradece a Fundacion Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, the "canton of love", has a warm and humid climate. It is full of friendly and hardworking people. Many domestic and international tourists come to enjoy its marvelous waterfalls and leisure spots. Edwin lives in this canton, in a small area called San Juan de Puerto Quito. Edwin is a fighter. He is 33 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He has a seven-year-old daughter from a previous relationship, for whom he fights and works hard every day.

Edwin has applied for a loan to invest in starting up his own business, a pig farm. He is from a family with limited resources whose members have always worked in agriculture and livestock. Thanks to this, he had the opportunity to learn what he needed about raising pigs. He also learned from his studies. From his own experience, he knows that he will dedicate about 4 hours per day to this business.

With this investment, he will improve his standard of living and continue to contribute to his daughter's education. Edwin is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for their support and for this opportunity.

loans.use: to start his own pig farm.

loans.name: José Efraín

texts.es:
José de 38 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado de nivel académico,  la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

José se dedica al comercio compra y venta de cerdos,  este trabajo lo aprendió del papá que ejercía este oficio, él desde pequeño anduvo siempre trabajando con el padre y miraba que era buena la ganancia que le quedaba en este negocio,  así fue creciendo cuando ya sentía que él podía ser capaz de ejercer este oficio.  Comenzó comprando un cerdo y lo llevo a la plaza y lo vendió muy rápido y caro entonces fue ahí donde él le gusto más este trabajo; hoy en día anda por todo el cantón donde vive y los cantones aledaños comprando cerdos y luego va un día a la semana a la plaza a venderlos,  ahí ve muchas ganancias en ocasiones este oficio lo hace en compañía de la esposa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 3 cerdos y un saco de maíz para engordarlos y luego sacarlos a la venta para el destazo,  ya que de eso le queda muchas ganancias, esto le ayudara mucho ya que por eso quiere comprar más cerdos para que los ingresos sean muy buenos.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old. He finished 7th grade in school. His wife stays home and tends to housework. José makes a living buying and selling pigs. He learned this trade from his father who also did this kind of work. Since he was young, José used to work with his father and saw how profitable this work can be. When he got older, José felt that he was capable of doing this trade. He began by buying one pig and quickly sold it in the plaza for a good price. Since then he has like this work more and today he travels all throughout the region where people live in the countryside to buy pigs and then sell them in the plaza once a week. José's business has been very profitable and he carries out his work alongside his wife.

The loan José is requesting from CREDICAMPO will help him buy three pigs and a sack of corn to fatten them before he takes them to the plaza to sell them. Since this will generate much income, it will help José a lot because he can buy more pigs to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and a sack of corn to fatten them so he can later sell them in the plaza.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie is 33 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee to sell to her customers. Amie has borrowed and repaid five prior loans from NWTF and has run her general store for two years. She supplements her income by selling fish. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to provide a secure future to her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Ma.rona

texts.en:
Ma. Rona is 40 years old and has seven children. Ma. Rona is married and five of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Rona requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Rona has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma.Rona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as slippers.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 48 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Leah works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase household goods to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, coffee, etc.

Leah has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, and coffee.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Agustina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for 47 years now.

In the future, Agustina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a seaweed cultures business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her seaweed cultures business.

Prudencia has been in this business for 8 years. Prudencia earns more income from fishing.

Prudencia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her seaweed cultures.

loans.name: Maa Durga Group

texts.en:
“Maa Durga”, a Self Help Group, was formed in the year 2014 by 13 active women entrepreneurs of Sinapali village in the Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Sinapali is a semi-urban village with very good business potential. Chanchale is one of the members of this group, sitting second from the left with her hand raised. She is 32 years of age and lives with her husband and two sons. Chanchale hails from a middle class business family and is a highly ambitious lady.

Chanchale has been running a mobile phone repair and sales center for the last eight years with the help of her husband. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR form this business. With this small income, she hardly manages her family and business investments. She buys mobile phones and spare parts from the wholesale market, which is 150 miles away. Due to her good behavior, timely service and quality products, her business earned a good reputation. But shortage of finances was an obstacle for her to meet the demands of the customers. So she decided to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation by forming the above group for expansion and development of her business. She is planning to purchase a variety of new mobile phones and spare parts to reach out to more customers. She expects a good return from this investment. Chanchale hopes to purchase a computer for her shop and give a better education to her children.

The other 12 members of this group are also doing a variety of micro enterprise businesses for their livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of new mobile phones and spare parts

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна замужем. У нее есть сын и маленькая дочь. Татьяна имеет свой бизнес.

Татьяна продает косметику на рынке. Торговое место арендует. Татьяна занимается бизнесом всего два года, но за это время она смогла хорошо развить дело. Татьяна искренняя и открытая. Она любит выращивать  цветы. Татьяна в будущем хочет открыть еще одну торговую точку.

Татьяна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на закупку товара. Она расширяет торговое место и хочет заполнить его новым товаром.
texts.en: Tatyana is married and has a son and a young daughter.  Tatyana owns her business of selling cosmetic products at a local market, where she rents a stall.  She has been working in this business for only two years, however, during that time, she has been successful at making it grow.  Tatyana is honest and sincere.  She also likes to grow flowers and at some point in the future, she would like to open another stall at the market.  Tatyana is asking for a loan of 40,000 hryvnia to purchase additional items for her stall.  She is expanding her shop and wants to fill the new space with a variety of products.

loans.use: increase the assortment of her inventory

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y sus 02 hijas en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Eladio es la de sembrar maíz amarillo duro, para posteriormente comercializarlo en el mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para el pago a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Eladio is 30 years old. He lives in his own house, made of rustic materials, with his wife and their two daughters in the Pucará district. The Pucará district is a community with a hot climate located in the province of Jaén, which is part of the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains. The population there works in farming, commerce, and livestock production.

Eladio's business is the farming of hard yellow corn, which he later sells in the market of his district. He has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa in order to pay day laborers for maintenance of his corn crop.

loans.use: to pay day laborers for maintenance of his corn crop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of live fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more live fish to sell. 

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more live fish to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 44 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Lilibeth and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Lilibeth is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,866 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Lilibeth has been with NWTF borrower since 2010. She plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help Lilibeth can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 55 years old and married with five children. Carolina works very hard to provide for them.

Carolina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like detergent soap, fabric conditioner, sanitary pads, toothpaste, bath soap, seasonings etc. to sell.

Carolina has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, fabric conditioner, sanitary pads, toothpaste, bath soap, seasonings etc. 

Carolina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like detergent soap, fabric conditioner, sanitary pads, toothpaste, bath soap, seasonings etc. to sell

loans.name: Felipa Esperanza

texts.es:
Felipa de 53 años de edad,  estudio solamente sexto grado por motivos de que los padres no podían seguir enviándola a estudiar por lo económico.

  Felipa es casada el esposo se dedica a la agricultura, en esta relación ha procreado 10 hijos los cuales 4 de ellos están en la casa y tres de ellos en la escuela los demás están en hogares apartes.

Felipa  tienen una finca de café y ella le ayuda  al esposo,  ya que obtiene un beneficio también, ya tiene unos cuantos años de dedicarse a esto, ya tienen 20 años de dedicarse a este oficio junto con el esposo vieron la necesidad de trabajar y sacar adelante a los hijos la finca les queda a una distancia de 25 minutos y viaja a pie en esto se dedica un hijo y el esposo. 
     
El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 5 sacos de abono para  el café. El préstamo le ayudara mucho ya que los palitos van a crecer mucho y en buena calidad porque el abono a tiempo hará que crezcan muy bien.

Sus sueños son que Dios que le ayude y salga bien con esta siembra y que a futuro ella pueda tener una finca más grande y en ella poder sembrar más cultivos de frutas y de ahí le genere más ingresos con mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Felipa, age 53, only studied until the sixth grade, as her parents were unable to continue sending her to school due to economic reasons. Felipa is married, and her husband works in agriculture. They have 10 children, 4 of whom are at home, with 3 of these in school. The others have separate homes. 

Felipa has a coffee farm, and she helps her husband, as she makes a profit also.  She has been doing this for some years now, and together, she and her husband have devoted 20 years to this work, as they needed to provide for their children. She walks to the farm, which is 25 minutes away, accompanied by her husband and one of her children.

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is for the purchase of 5 sacks of compost for the coffee. The loan will help her very much, as the seedlings will grow substantially and be of good quality, because in time, the compost will make them grow very well.

Her dreams are:  that God may help her, that this planting may do well, and that she may have a bigger farm in the future where she could plant more fruit crops, and with much effort, generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of compost for the coffee.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 43 years old and single.

Ma. Fe and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Ma. Fe is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Ma. Fe has been with NWTF since 2011. She plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help Ma. Fe can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 50 years old, married and has four children. 

She is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Julieta has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cecilia is 50 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Cecilia has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future Cecilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Leidy Carolina

texts.es:
Leidy es una joven soñadora y muy activa, a sus 20 años tiene conocimiento en el oficio de arreglo de uñas y belleza gracias a pequeños cursos realizados en academias y a su trabajo.
Ella desea avanzar y tener un negocio mucho mas consolidado, por esta razón solicita un apoyo financiero para comprar un escritorio, mesas para manicura y pedicura, herramientas de trabajo, esmaltes, publicidad, decoración de un local y productos para vender al público como esmaltes y accesorios.
Todos estos elementos le permitirán a Leidy montar un Spa de uñas que planea sacar adelante con gran entusiasmo.
La gran ventaja es la cantidad de clientes que tiene y que conocen su trabajo.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un negocio prospero y que genere buenos ingresos y empleos, así podrá continuar con sus estudios y ayudara con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Leidy is a very active and visionary young woman. At twenty years old, she has knowledge in the trade of beauty and nail care thanks to her work and to short courses taken in academies.

She would like to advance and have a much more established business, so she is requesting financial support to buy a desk, manicure and pedicure tables, work implements, nail polishes, marketing materials, decoration of a shop, and products to sell to the public, like nail polishes and accessories.

All these components will allow Leidy to set up a nail spa that she plans to run with great enthusiasm. The big advantage is the number of clients that she has and who know her work.

Her greatest dream is to be able to have a prosperous business that generates good income and jobs, so that she will be able to continue with her education and help with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy components to start her own business, like tools and fixed assets

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 46 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, soft drinks, soap, etc. to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, soft drinks, soap to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fish vending business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Melinda will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Charine

texts.en:
Charine is 33 years old and married with three children.

Charine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Charine has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Charine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Remia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Remia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Remia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

Ruby has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future Ruby would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, coffee, milk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish her technical degree and give her children a better quality of life

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Melona is 33 years old and has four children who are in school.

Melona's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her dry goods business and is committed to regain what she lost. Melona is taking out a PHP 9,720 Housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Melona has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit of her aim to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Melona would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Edwina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs. Edwina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear like blouses, t-shirts, kids ware, etc. to sell for her business.

Edwina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear like blouses, t-shirts, kids ware to sell.

loans.name: Sedreta

texts.en:
Sedreta works hard to support her family. Sedreta is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Sedreta has been in this business for 34 years now.

In the future, Sedreta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 48 years old and married with three children.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Elsa has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and raising pigs.

Elsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Evelina has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Etna

texts.es: Etna: Es originaria de Managua, tiene 50 año de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos que estudian su secundaria y carrera universitaria. Con el propósito de tener una vivienda segura, solicita financiamiento para construir su casa de tambo de madera de 16 pies*20pies: madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es establecer un comedor.
texts.en:
Etna is originally from Managua and she is 50 years old. She is the single mother of three children, who are students in secondary school and college.

For the purpose of having a secure home, she requests a loan to build her wooden stilt house, 16x20 feet:  wood, zinc, nails, and to cover labor costs. Her dream is to establish a restaurant.

loans.use: to build her wooden stilt house, 16x20 feet.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 55 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Elsa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsa has been in pig-fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 45 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rowena has restarted her buying and selling frozen foods business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rowena has taken a PHP 8,853 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rowena is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Arlene is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is 34 years old, a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Rocelyn's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Rocelyn is taking out a PHP 9,213 Housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Rocelyn has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit of her aim to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Rocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase monitors, game consoles, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Al- Tawon Ramadan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Tawon Ramadan. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Yasamin is a 34-year-old married woman with three children. She is the leader of the group. Yasamin lives with her family in their own house. She studied until secondary school, but couldn't complete her studies. She works as a housewife. Her husband is an employee in the Yemeni army as an officer. The salary that he receives from his job is enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Unfortunately, the house where Yasamin, her husband, and their children live is old and it needs renovation, which will cost them lot of money. As a result, Yasamin is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials with her husband such as cement, bricks, and steel, in order to renovate their house and build new rooms to make the house more comfortable and large.

Yasamin's dream is renovate the house to be very spacious and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials with her husband such as cement, bricks, and steel in order to renovate their house

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector and earns a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Ahmad is a student in the university, where he studies business administration. He would like to find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Ahmad took a United States dollar Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to do his home work and write reports easily. 

Ahmad appears in the photo in the computer store.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more of goats to raise and sell in the local markets for profit.

loans.name: Rene Rose

texts.en:
Rene Rose is 40 years old and has three children. Rene Rose is married and has three children who are in school.

Rene Rose and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Rene Rose is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,793 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Rene Rose has been with NWTF since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help Rene Rose can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flagstones and cement in order to renovate his house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Agim

texts.en:
Agim is in the photograph with Bukurije, his wife; they are both ethnic Egyptians. 

Agim is seeking your compassion so that he can take his wife (who became paralyzed about three months ago) to health specialists in nearby countries. Bukurije suffered some sudden high blood pressure that left her paralyzed and speechless.  

Agim does garment trade, and he is good at it, with a well-established store clientele. HIs wife's health condition left him penniless, as he has spent lots of money to find a proper diagnosis and possible treatment for her.

loans.use: to take his recently paralyzed wife to health specialists.

loans.name: Mercedes Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora mercedes es habitante de una comunidad llamada valle nuevo que esta ubicada a 20 minutos de  chichigalpa es casada tiene una niña de 3 años su esposo actualmente se encuentra sin trabajo ella tiene un negocio de venta de chancho con yuca en el mercado municipal de chichigalpa desde hace 1 año es una joven trabajadora emprendedora ella inicia su día de trabajo desde las 4:00 AM que se levanta a cocer la yuca para estar a las 6:00 de la mañana en el mercado para iniciar su venta ya que este alimento es utilizado como desayuno en la mayoría de los habitantes de chichigalpa.

la señora es una mujer responsable, amable, que sueña con darle una mejor vida a su única hija.
texts.en: Mercedes lives in a community called Valle Nuevo which is located 20 minutes away from Chichigalpa. She is married and has a 3 year old daughter. Her husband is presently without work. She has had a business selling pork cooked with yucca in the municipal market of Chichigalpa for one year. She is a young enterprising worker who starts her day at 4am. She gets up to cook the yucca in order to be in the market at 6 am to start her sales. This dish is eaten as breakfast by the majority of inhabitants of Chichigalpa. Mercedes is a responsible friendly woman who dreams of providing a better life for her only daughter.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Geydy Karenia

texts.es:
La señora Geydy es casada tiene un niño en edad escolar su esposo trabaja en una cooperativa de transporte como soldador ella es habitante de una comunidad llamada valle nuevo que esta ubicada a 20 minutos de chichigalpa cuenta con un negocio de venta de chancho con yuca desde hace 3 años es una mujer trabajadora que apoya a su esposo en los gastos de su casa.

la señora vive en casa de su suegra el sueño que ella tiene es poder llegar a tener su casa para vivir con su esposo y su hijo.ella inicia un dia de trabajo desde las 6:00 de la mañana que llega al mercado y termina al medio día.
texts.en: Geydy is married and has a school-aged child. Her husband works in a transportation cooperative as a welder. She is a resident of a community called Valle Nuevo that is located 20 minutes from Chichigalpa. She has had a business selling pork with yucca for the past 3 years. She is a hard-working woman who supports her husband with the household expenses. Geydy lives in the house of her mother-in-law and dreams that one day she'll be able to have her own house to live in with her husband and her son. She starts her work day at 6 am when she arrives at the market and finishes at 12 noon.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is 38 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her trisikad (pedicab) transportation business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Nemia is taking out a PHP 9,066 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2011 in her quest to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell at her buy and sell rice grains business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant chili peppers.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 38 years old, married, and has one child who is currently in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 56 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Nilda and her family survived the super typhoon, Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Nilda is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 8,740 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour to build a house for her family. 

Nilda has been with NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her buying and selling of dried fish.

With your help, Nilda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour.

loans.name: Ma. Merlina

texts.en:
Ma. Merlina is 49 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Ma. Merlina is in the agricultural business; pig-fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Merlina has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Merlina has been in pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Merlina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nicole Lissett

texts.es:
La Joven Nicole es habitante de posoltega municipio de chinandega es soltera estudia la carrera de contabilidad publica esta en su ultimo año de la universidad la joven tiene un negocio de venta de leche, frijoles cocidos desde hace 1 año es una joven emprendedora ella se dedica a este tipo de negocio para mantener sus gastos de la universidad y su alimentación.


La joven solicito este crédito para invertir en ropa usada para obtener mas ganancias ya que ella tiene que pagar los módulos y el titulo de su carrera ella cuenta con la poca ayuda que sus padres le pueden brindar ya que ellos no cuentan con un salario son personas que trabajan en el campo y en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Nicole is a young woman who lives in Posoltega, a municipality of Chinandega.  She is single and studying for a public accounting degree, and is in her last year of university.  For a year she has been running a business selling milk and cooked beans to cover her university and food costs.

Nicole is requesting a loan to buy used clothing to earn more profit because she has to pay tuition and cover the cost of her diploma.  She has very little help from her parents since they do not earn a salary, but work in agriculture as farmers.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to earn more profit to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Leiscian

texts.en:
Leiscian is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal-selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like coconut shells for her charcoal business.

Leiscian has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Leiscian has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like coconut shells for her charcoal business

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is 40 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Nita has taken a PHP 7,906 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

She is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonarda works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Leonarda is borrowing PHP 15,                              000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Leonarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Lilia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Myrna is 46 years old and has four children who are in school.

Myrna's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Myrna is taking out a PHP 9,646 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Myrna has been with NWTF since 2010 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pineapples, corn, peanuts, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Metusela

texts.en:
Metusela works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her frozen foods business and is now requesting a PHP 9,800 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Metusela will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future Metusela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Merlisa

texts.en:
Merlisa is 31 years old and has four children.  Merlisa is married and three of her children are in school.

Merlisa and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Merlisa has been with NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her food vending business.

With your help, Merlisa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Zarina
