texts.ru: Зарина родилась в 1994 году. Она молодая и энергичная женщина. Зарина не замужем и живет с родителями. Она 2 года назад начала свой бизнес предоставлением услуги швеи. Зарина имеет свой швейный цех. Зарина шьет национальные женские одежды, а также она шьет занавески. Благодаря хорошему сервису она имеет постоянных клиентов. Зарина планирует отремонтировать дом, где она живет вместе со своей мамой. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zarina was born in 1994. She is a young and energetic woman. Zarina is not married and lives with her parents. She started her seamstress business 2 years ago. Zarina has her own sewing shop. Zarina sews national women's clothing and drapes. Thanks to her good service, she has regular customers. Zarina plans to repair her house, where she lives with her mother. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10 000 somoni to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 27 años de edad soltero y padre de 2 hijos.
Él vive en sacaba distante a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Cochabamba, trabaja como chofer de taxi y su tiempo libre lo dedica a sus hijos. Hace poco terminó la construcción de su sueño, su hogar; un dormitorio, baño, patio y cocina, sus niños están muy ansiosos por habitar su casa pero esta no tiene ventanas ni puertas y la conexión de agua todavía no está terminada, aún se encuentra en obra gruesa porque no cuenta con el dinero para terminarla.
David es un hombre joven de tez morena cabello negro y manos duras por el trabajo, él y su familia viven en un dormitorio con baño compartido en alquiler, constantemente cambian de vivienda porque sus niños juegan todo el día, hacen mucho ruido y eso incomoda a los vecinos. Los niños son pequeños el mayor va a cumplir cuatro años de edad, corre todo el día, la menor va a cumplir dos años; grita y salta hasta cansarse.
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para instalación de agua en su casa y darles un hogar donde correr a sus hijos.
texts.en:
David is a 27-year-old man, single, and the father of two children.  He lives in Sacaba, a 45 minute distance from the city of Cochabamba.  He works as a taxi driver and he dedicates his free time to his children.  A little while ago he finished constructing his dream, his home: one bedroom, a bath, patio, and kitchen.  His children are very anxious to live in the house but it does not have windows or doors, and the water connection is not finished yet - it is still in progress because he does not have the money to finish it.

David is a dark-skinned man, with black hair, and hands rough from work.  He lives with his family in a rented room with a shared bathroom.  They constantly change housing because his children play all day; they make a lot of noise and this is inconvenient for the neighbors.  The children are young.  The oldest is going to turn four, he runs all day; the youngest is going to turn two, he screams and jumps until he is tired.  This is why David asks for a loan to install water in his house and give his children a place to run around in.

loans.use: to install running water in his house and give his children a place to run around in

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla es una mujer de 27 años de edad soltera, madre de dos hijos y su negocio es una ferretería propia que atiende de lunes a domingo.
Ella es de carácter alegre y sonriente se caracteriza por conocer muy bien su negocio y siempre encuentra soluciones para las peticiones de sus clientes, su negocio lo realiza en el ‘Plan 3000’ distante a 30 minutos en vehículo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este lugar se caracteriza por la humedad del ambiente y las elevadas temperaturas durante todo el año.
Cada día se levanta muy temprano por la mañana y se dirige al depósito donde guarda sus productos, recoge sus cajas y se instala en su puesto de venta en el mercado de su barrio. Ella sueña tener algún día un local propio, bajo techo y piensa que para lograrlo debe ampliar su negocio ahora. Los gastos de sus hijos hacen que ella trabaje sin descanso y eso también limita el tiempo que ella les dedica a su cuidado y atención.
Es por esos motivos que Carla solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su ferretería y así dar un paso más para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Carla is a 27 year old woman. She is single and the mother of two children. Her business is a hardware store that she owns and runs from Monday to Sunday. She is a smiling, cheerful person who knows a lot about her business and always finds solutions for her clients' requests. Her business is located in ‘Plan 3000’, a 30 minute drive from the city of Santa Cruz. It is characterized by humidity and high temperatures all year round.

 Every day, she gets up very early in the morning and goes to where she stores her products. She picks up her boxes and she sets up her sales stall in the market in her neighborhood. She dreams of someday having her own store with a roof and she thinks that in order to obtain this goal, she needs to increase her sales and expand her business now. The costs of her children require Carla to work without much rest, limiting the time she spends on the well being and health of her and her family. That is why Carla is asking for a loan to expand her hardware business and thus come one step closer to achieving her dream.

loans.use: to expand her hardware store and thus come one step closer to achieving her dream.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 53 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been raising pigs for 24 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream - to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mishach

texts.en:
Mishach is a 30-year-old married man with four children and two very old parents who depend on him. He deals in cattle fattening and milk trade as his major source of income. He owns 70 cows of which a majority are for milk production. With income from his milk trade, Mishach has managed to look after his family, including his parents, by providing them with medication, paying school fees for his children, and constructing a permanent house for the family.
Mishach is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy land to graze his cows.
His challenge is inadequate land for his increasing number of cows. He wants to be the leading supplier of high-quality milk in his region. Mishach is honest and a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy grazing land.

loans.name: Ma. Veronica

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Ma. Veronica works hard to support her family. She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store.

Ma. Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a new loan of PHP 19500 to purchase additional beauty products for her business.

Ma. Veronica hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products for her business

loans.name: Marisel

texts.en:
Marisel is married and has been working hard to support her family for 10 years now through her fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for that business.

In the future, Marisel would like to save money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Nozanin

texts.ru: Нозанин добрая женщина. Она является мастером своего дела.  Нозанин опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Ей 27 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 5 лет назад она начала свой бизнес. Она имеет ателье в центре города. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Она нуждается новой швейной машинки, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки 2 новых швейных машинок. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nozanin is a kind woman. She is an expert at her business. Nozanin is a skilled seamstress, who creates Tajik national dress masterpieces. She is 27 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. To provide her family with all of the necessities, she started her own business 5 years ago. She has an atelier in the city center. Thanks to her good service, she has a wide circle of customers. She needs a new sewing machine, but her income does not allow her to purchase it. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy 2 sewing machines. She relies on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like soft-drinks, coffee, beers, seasonings, cereals, canned goods, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soft drinks, coffee, beer, seasonings, cereals, canned goods, detergent soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Phoebles

texts.en:
Phoebles is 19 years old, married and has one kid. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,866 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She plans to recover through her buying and selling frozen foods business. Phoebles has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Phoebles can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Jean is 36 years old and has four children who are currently in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has three children who are in school. Miraluna has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines and has been in this business for 22 years. 

Miraluna requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to make dried fish. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is 47 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like chocolate drink, milk, juice, coffee, sugar, shampoo, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Medina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like chocolate drink, milk, juice, coffee, sugar, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 55 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 24 years and also earns additional income from fish vending. Ma. Luz is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lenie is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lenie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lenie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lenie has been in this business for ten years. In the future Lenie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Dora Elena

texts.es:
Dora una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora que ha logrado grandes cosas gracias a su determinación y pensamiento de grandeza pues todo lo que se puede ver de su hogar lo ha construido gracias a sus ventas, se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Solicita un crédito para iniciar formalmente un negocio en su hogar pues con el paso del tiempo ha atraído clientes fieles que le compran muy seguido, el creedito lo invertira en la compra de ropa para hombre y dama.
Su sueño es siempre mejorar nunca cambiar de pensamiento y creer que cada día puede superarse como persona y como empresaria
texts.en:
Dora is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who has achieved great things thanks to her determination and thoughts of grandeur. Everything you see in her home was built as a result of her sales. She works in the business of selling clothing. 

She has applied for a loan to formally start her business in her home. Over time, she has attracted loyal customers who buy from her regularly. The loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing for men and women. Her dream is to continue improving, never changing her disposition, and to believe that with each day she can improve as a person and businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Villa Rayanniyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANIYOC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Taray, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina ella es conviviente y tiene 25 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de verduras.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia que sale adjunta en la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Villa Rayaniyoc communal bank. This group is located in the Taray district, which is part of Calca province in Cusco department.

The borrower is Bernardina. She is 25 years old, cohabiting, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells various types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, among others. She takes good care of her business which is doing well thanks to the dedication she gives to her business each day. She hopes to continue working this way in order to continue to support her family. The other members have businesses such as selling animals, agriculture, grocery store and selling vegetables.

She is applying for a loan to buy rice and more. The borrower is grateful to those who form part of this dream in this way, and promises to make her installment payments as scheduled.

The member who appears in the attached corner photo asked permission to be late to the meeting because of work purposes.

loans.use: to buy rice and more.

loans.name: Melogene

texts.en:
Melogene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 16 years and earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Melogene dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hard working entrepreneur from Coron Palawan, Philippines. She is 32 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Edgardo, her husband, works as a construction worker. She sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family. Maricel’s family is one of the affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost.

Maricel buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

Maricel is taking out PHP 19,000 loan assistance to continue operations of her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she wants her business to continue to flourish and she desires for her children to finish schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fish to be sold at the market.

loans.name: Mergelina

texts.en:
Mergelina is 59 years old and married with four children.

Mergelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, detergent soap and other groceries to sell.

Mergelina has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Mergelina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn has been in this business for seven years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is a married woman with seven children, one of whom who is still in school. She is is 55 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.   

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Felicisima has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eufrocenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Eufrocenia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fresh fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening. Eufrocenia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy and sell fresh fish business.

Eufrocenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and selling dried fish. Nancy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, two of whom in school, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and food vending. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Orozbubu

texts.ru: Орозбубу 50 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Орозбубу в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи с 2003 года занимается животноводством, также на 1 ГА собственной поливной земли выращивает многолетние травы для заготовки корма. В хозяйстве Орозбубу есть 3 коровы и 2 теленка. Продажа молока, молочных продуктов и перепродажа скота приносит в месяц около 5,000 сом (KGS). Также муж Орозбубу  в сезон предоставляет услуги комбайнера. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Орозбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки овец. Доходы от кредита Орозбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Orozbubu is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. To provide the primarily source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 2003. She also owns 1 hectare of land, where she grows perennial herbs as a livestock feed. Orozbubu's business contains 3 cows and 2 calves. Sales of milk, milk products and resale of livestock yield approximately 5,000 som (KGS) per month. Also, Orozbubu's husband provides combine harvester operator services during the season. In order to further develop her business, Orozbubu requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to increase livestock headcount by buying sheep. Orozbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 35 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Shiela works very hard to provide for them.

Shiela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, dish washing soap, shampoo, detergent soap etc. to sell.

Shiela has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, dish washing soap, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future Shiela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, dish washing soap, shampoo, detergent soap etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for cell phones and computers.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Pablita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Pablita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Pablita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Rebecca is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is 36 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Glory has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 3 years and also earns an income from a general store and raising pigs.

Glory aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of chracoal to sell

loans.name: Anle

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Anle works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Anle is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices to sell in her food stall.

Anle has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are currently in school.

Rose is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rose requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rose has been farming sugarcane for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Leona works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Leona is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish for her business.

Leona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Lhea

texts.en:
Lhea is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lhea is 30 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Lhea requested a 19,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish to make dried fish. Lhea has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future, Lhea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lilia works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lilia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like four, yeast, milk, sugar, etc. for her food vending business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, yeast, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Violeta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as vegetables, fish, meat, cooking oil, spices, etc., for her food production business.

Violeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as vegetables, fish, meat, cooking oil, spices, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a 52-year-old married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Amalia has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family’s home.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Emma Jaqueline

texts.es:
Emma de 33 años de edad, pudo estudiar  hasta el 9° grado, ella es casada, su esposo es cocinero, ellos tienen dos hijos, solamente uno asiste a la escuela su familia esta conformada por sus dos hijos y su esposo los que viven con ella solo sus hijos depende de ella.
	
 Emma se dedica a realizar las labores del hogar, a cuidar sus hijos y ella cuenta con muchos deseos de superación y es por ello que tiene 12 meses de haber iniciado la crianza de pollos  de engorde, y con ello ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos y del hogar. El negocio le a funcionado bien eso a ayudado a tener mejores ingresos para los gastos del hogar. Es por eso que esta dispuesta a continuar trabajando en esta actividad productiva.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de mas pollos, concentrado y vitaminas para la nutrición y desarrollo de estos.

El sueño de Emma es ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad, y mejorar la calidad de vida para toda su familia, también desea tener una granja agrícola de gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
Emma is 33 years old and was able to study until 9th grade. She's married, and her husband is a chef. They have two children, only one of whom goes to school. Their family is made up of her two children and her husband, who live alone with her. Her children depend on her.

Emma earns a living doing housework and taking care of her children. She has a great desire to excel and because of this, she began raising and fattening chickens 12 months ago. With this, she helps her husband with her children and household's expenses. 

The business has worked well and has helped her have better income for household expenses. Because of this, she's inclined to continue working in this productive activity.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of more chickens, and concentrate and vitamins for their nutrition and development.

Emma's dream is to see her children graduate from college and improve the quality of life for their entire family. She would also like to have a farm of hens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens, and concentrate and vitamins for their nutrition and development.

loans.name: Cristino Gerardo

texts.es: Cristino Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 59 años, está casado, vive con su esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  materiales para poder mejorar la construcción de un local donde pueda tener y desarrollar algunos cerdos para el engorde.  La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene y las buenas condiciones para ubicar un chiquero  para los cerdos. Además de tener unos cerdos de buena calidad que a corto plazo puedan estar gordos y de buena calidad. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en el proyecto y a la vez darle más ingresos económicos a su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Cristino Gerardo is 59 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife, who is his top priority.  

With his loan, he plans to buy materials to improve a building where he can raise some pigs to fatten.  This idea is to take advantage of the space that he has in order to have good conditions to place a pigsty for the hogs.  Additionally, he will have some high quality pigs which, in the short term, can be fattened and in good condition.  With this purchase he will be able to carry out the plan, while at the same time saving money that will allow him to have more animals and invest more in the project.  Meanwhile he can provide more income for his family.  

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn’t had any previous loans from state banks, and FUDECOSUR has granted him the loan more easily and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to fatten pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married, with four children. She is 45 years old and lives in Anonang, Dumalinao, ZDS. 

To earn a living, Gina has a farm that grows fruits and vegetables. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.

Gina has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. In the future, she hopes to buy land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Pagadian - Anonang, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a cashew nuts-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of cashew nuts to sell.

Marites has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and married with six children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid seventeen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from used clothing.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 33 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa roofing business for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut meat and crabs.

Maribel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 54 years old and married, with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, charcoal, sugar, and groceries.

Marietta has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Marietta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, charcoal, sugar, and groceries.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 58 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Margarita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Margarita has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to buy a delivery truck for her fishing business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire labourers for weeding, pruning and harvesting the crops.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is married, with four children. She is 53 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

To earn a living, Mercedita is a farmer, growing corn crops. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer and insecticide.

Mercedita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. In the future, she hopes to put up another profitable business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Sherlena

texts.en:
Sherlena is married, with five children. She is 50 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement, Philippines.

Sherlena is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizer.

Sherlena has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. In the future, she hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Joselyn is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Joselyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items, like snack foods, spices, dried fish, and other groceries.

Joselyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items, like snack foods, spices, dried fish, and other groceries.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Joseph is 20 years old and is the fourth of the four children in the family. His mother, Victoria, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Joseph is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Agriculture and is currently in the third year of this four-year course.

Victoria, Joseph's mother, is borrowing PHP 10,000 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Joseph plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has operated a food selling business. She mentioned high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she thanks Yehu and Kiva for their low-cost loan services.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
María de 71 años de edad,  solo estudio  hasta 4° grado por la situación económica que vivía su familia, esta soltera y tiene 3 hijos quienes ya están acompañados y solo vive con uno de ellos, quien esta pendiente de ella.

María,  toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar en los oficios domésticos de una manera  muy dura, para sacar adelante a sus hijos, por ello es una mujer con deseos de superarse, tiene un negocio de tortillas en su casa, esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos, para sacar adelante su hogar, este oficio lo realiza diario; sus labores diarios comienzan a las 9:00 AM y lo finaliza a las 4:00 PM.


El crédito sera utilizado para comprar arena, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para terminar de reparar su vivienda. 

María  desea en tener salud para tener las fuerzas para trabajar. También le gustaría comprar otro terreno, para dejarles como herencia a sus hijos. Sabe que todo esto lo lograra esforzándose mucho, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho
texts.en:
María, age 71, only studied through the fourth grade, due to the financial situation that her family lived in.  She is unmarried and has three children who are all in relationships.  Only one of them lives with her; he looks out for her.

All her life, María worked extremely hard as household help in order to get her children ahead.  She is a woman with a desire to improve herself.  She has a tortilla business in her home.  This is her only source of income to take care of her household.  Her daily work begins at 9:00 a.m. and ends at 4:00 p.m.

María wants to be healthy in order to have the strength to work.  She would also like to buy another plot of land to leave as an inheritance to her children.  She knows that she can accomplish all this by putting forth a big effort, as she has done to this day.

This loan will be used to buy sand, cement, and rebar, and to pay for the labor to finish making repairs on her home.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and rebar, and to pay for the labor to finish making repairs on her home.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is widowed with five children. She is 54 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement Tudela, Philippines.

Luz is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers. 

Luz has been a member of PMPC for eleven months. In the future, she hopes to save for some future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Merlinda has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 44 years old and married, with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like bread, charcoal, salt, shampoo, soap, and sugar.

Nora has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice and vegetables.

Nora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like bread, charcoal, salt, shampoo, soap, sugar, milo, and groceries.

loans.name: Reysa

texts.en:
Reysa is a 23-year-old, married woman, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Reysa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Reysa has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to make dried fish from.

Nory has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish from.

loans.name: Juby

texts.en:
Nelvie is 15 years old and is the first of three children in the family. Her mother, Juby, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Nelvie is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Juby, Nelvie's mother, is borrowing PHP 6,335 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Nelvie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Yansi Judith

texts.es: Yansi de 25 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 2 años se dedica al cultivo  y venta de plátano. Su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura sembrando diversidad de productos como:  caña de azúcar, maíz, pipían, etc. Yansi desea encementar el piso de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar arena, cemento y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yansi, age 25, lives with her life partner and two children, ages nine and two.  She is an enterprising woman.  She has been growing and selling bananas for two years.  Her life partner devotes himself to agriculture by growing diverse products like sugarcane, corn, and pumpkins, etc.

Yansi wishes to put down a concrete floor in her house.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sand, cement, and gravel to lay down a concrete floor in her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and gravel to lay down a concrete floor in her house.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Elisa is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elisa has been farming corn for six years and earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 35 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, snack food, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jovy is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jovy has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Jovy has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 63 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of bamboo split in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bamboo to sell.

Violeta has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of bamboo split for three years and earns additional income from her buy and sell of dried fish and raising goats businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to offer for sale.

Salvacion successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Salvacion's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leather to make his products.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is married with five children. Rosario is 49-years-old and lives in Libertad Alto, Philippines.

Rosario is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Rosario hopes to save more for consumption.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 46 years old, married and the mother of seven children who lives in Camanga, Dumalinao ZDS. She earns a living by selling spices and vegetables and has been in this line of work for twelve years. Each month, she earns PHP 15,000, and is requesting a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy more spices and vegetables to sell. Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. Her goal for the future is to have another stall in the market where she can sell more spices and vegetable. This will allow her to better support her family and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy more spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Sally works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing. Sally is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en: Arcelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy more produce to sell. Arcelita has been in this business for three years and supplements her income by running a general store. She has been sustaining her business through her own hard work with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegtable to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 53 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Wilma has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 40 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Imelda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Imelda has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Señor De Los Temblores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes Malena la socia continua con su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos como refrigeradoras, lavadoras, ollas y cocinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cocinas, entre otros.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo después la foto porque pidieron permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de imprenta, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
The members belong to Señor de los Temblores Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Lourdes Malena, still has her business selling electrical appliances such as refrigerators, washing machines, ovens, and stoves.  She has had the business for a long time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to keep on working and supporting her family.

Lourdes Malena's requesting the loan to buy stoves and other items.

The other members earn their livings at fruit sales, a printing business, a grocery store, and appliance sales.

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo had permission to have their pictures taken later because of work.

loans.use: to buy stoves and other items

loans.name: Vergilita

texts.en:
Vergilita is married with six children. She is 67 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Philippines.

Vergilita is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to buy six sacks of fertilizers and pesticides for her corn plantation.

Vergilita has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, she hopes to put up other businesses.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of fertilizers and pesticides for her corn plantation.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 62-years-of-age and a resident of Canal, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married with 23 siblings. They have a little gasoline retail business from which to earn for a living.  With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Crispina and her husband work hard selling their gasoline in their outlets and some sidelines. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business.  They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 45,000 loan.  They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Crsipina smiles at the thought of seeing their living into a positive change.

loans.use: to buy gasolines for her existing business

loans.name: Glen

texts.en:
Glen is 37 years old, married and a resident of Canal, Siquijor, Philippines. His wife is his partner in their business. They have 5 children, of which 3 are in school.

Starting with capitalization of 5,000 PHP, he opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, he was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. He became a member in December 2010 and has taken out seven loans. 

Now he is applying for 40,000 PHP to buy additional stock for his sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, he wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if he sees his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy products for sari-sari store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. 

Victoria is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional vegetables to sell through her buy-and-sell vegetables business, like carrots, eggplants, tomatoes, and string beans.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell, like carrots, eggplants, tomatoes, and string beans.

loans.name: Dúo Dios Es Mi Guia Group

texts.es: Dúo Dios es mi Guia A cargo de este grupo está la señora Ofelia quien se dedica a la venta de blusas de tela para dama en diferentes tallas, colores y estilos desde hace varios años y es vendedora ambulante.  Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo  y también es vendedora en mercados de diferentes lugares los fines de semana.  Su sueño es seguir creciendo cada día y llegar a tener un local propio para tener su mercadería en un solo lugar.   A pesar de la gran pérdida que tuvo de mercadería porque fue asaltada, tienen varios pedidos de blusas para poder entregar,  y para poder lograrlo necesita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar las docenas de blusas que le hacen falta y no quedarles mal a sus compradores.
texts.en:
The Dios Es Mi Guía Duo is a group headed by Señora Ofelia, who has been selling women’s blouses in different sizes, colors, and styles for several years. She has her husband’s unconditional support. She sells on foot, and she also sells in different markets on the weekends. 

Her dream is to continue growing each day and come to have a store of her own, in order to have her merchandise in a single place.  She lost a lot of merchandise because she was assaulted; but in spite of this, she has several orders for blouses to fulfill, and she needs a new loan in order to purchase the dozens of blouses that are lacking, so that she doesn’t disappoint her buyers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Daisy Mae

texts.en:
Daisy Mae is 41-years-old, married and lives in Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hogs for raising and feed

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol de 43 años de edad,  estudio hasta 8° grado, sus padres ya no tenían los recursos  económicos para poder dar una mejor estudio.  Está acompañada, tiene un hijo, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultor.


Marisol se a dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura desde la edad de 15 años, ya que sus padres fueron agricultores. Actualmente tiene 15 años de trabajar como empleada doméstica. Es una mujer con muchos ideales, y con muchos deseos de superarse en la vida.

El crédito será invertido para comprar 2 toretes y una vaca, así tendrá otra fuente de ingreso el próximo año, ya que podrá venderlos a mejor precio, con la ayuda de su esposo, quien estará a cargo del cuidado de estos bovinos.

Marisol tiene el sueño de mejorar su vivienda, la cual tiene piso de tierra, la lámina tiene agujeros donde penetra el agua cuando esta lluvioso. También, desea continuar trabajando para tener más ganado y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marisol, 43, studied up to the eighth grade.  Her parents no longer had the economic resources to be able to give her a better education.  She has a companion, who works in agriculture, and a son.

Marisol has worked in agriculture since the age of 15 because her parents were farmers.  Currently she has worked for 15 years as a domestic worker.  She's a woman with a lot of ideals and a great desire to improve herself in life.

She'll invest her loan in buying two young bulls and a cow.  That way she'll have another source of income next year, because she'll be able to sell them at a better price with the help of her husband, who will be responsible for taking care of the bovines.

Marisol dreams of improving her house, which has a dirt floor and holes in the metal sheets where the water comes in when it's rainy.  In addition, she wants to keep on working to have more cattle and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls and a cow

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Hardworking mother best describes Lilia, 52-years-old, who resides in the Tigbawan Municipality of Lazi Siquior, Philippines. Lilia has three children and is married to a businessman.  The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs for their family. So Lilia started a business, a food stand or “carenderia.” Lilia has been in the business more than a year now. 

Lilia wants to expand her food stand business.  She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children. In order for Lilia to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 20,000 of additional capital and will use the money to expand her business.  She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things needed for the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and stock for her business

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es: José de 50 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos dos varones de 14 y 11 años y una hija de 21 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida desde hace 10 años como pequeño comerciante  en el mercado central de su localidad. Vende variedad de artículos como: cortauñas, candados, coladores, fósforos, jabón de baño, dulces, etc. José desea seguir construyendo su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía esta en construcción por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento y arena para poder terminar de construir lo antes posible y darle mayor seguridad a su familia y sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en: José, who is 50 years old, lives with his wife and their three children: two boys, ages 14 and 11, and a daughter, age 21. He is an entrepreneurial man who has earned his living for 10 years as a small businessman in the central market of his area. He sells a variety of articles such as nail clippers, locks, strainers, matches, bath soap, sweets, etc. José wants to continue building his home, since, as can be seen in the photograph, it is under construction. For this reason, he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy cement and sand to be able to finish building as soon as possible and give better security to his family and their few belongings.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to be able to finish building the walls of his home.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en: Criselda is married with two children in adult age. She is 50 years of age and has a transportation type of business. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 per month. Criselda wants to engage a new type of business. She requested PHP 50,000 to purchase a motor unit. In the future Criselda wants to earn more profit to provide good living conditions and good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a motor unit.

loans.name: Edwin Balmore

texts.es:
Edwin de 28 años estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado, su esposa es ama de casa. Tienen dos hijos, además vive la abuela y él  ayuda con sus gastos.

Edwin trabaja en la agricultura desde los 12 años, oficio que aprendió de su padre. Actualmente siembra 10,000 metros de cultivo de maíz y yuca. También tiene cinco años de trabajar como barrendero en el municipio, por lo cual tiene que trasladarse todos los días en autobús, para lograr llegar a su trabajo. Donde labora de las 6.30 am hasta las 3.00 pm

El crédito será utilizado para comprar un terreno, de esta forma se está contribuyendo a que Edwin pueda tener un lugar propio donde vivir.

Edwin tiene el sueño de poseer ganado, además le gustaría tener un vehículo para  trabajar vendiendo frutas y verduras. De esta forma, podría darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 28 years old. He went to school up to high school. He is married and his wife is a housewife. They have two children and he also lives wit his grandmother and he contributes for the expenses.  

Edwin has worked in agriculture for 12 years. He learned this trade from his father. Right now, he plants 10,000 meters of corn and yucca crops. He has also been working for five years as a street sweeper for the city. He gets to his job every day by bus where he works from 6:30 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.

The loan will be used to buy a plot of land. This will contribute to Edwin being able to have his own place to live. Edwin has a dream of owning his own cattle. He would also like to have a vehicle to work selling fruit and vegetables. That way, he could give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land in this way contribute to Edwin having his own place to live.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia Livia pertenece al banco comunal CAMINANDO JUNTOS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Livia tiene 45 años de edad, separada y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como aroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Group member Livia belongs to the  CAMINANDO JUNTOS Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the district of Echarate, in La Convención Province, Cusco Department.

Livia is 45 years old, separated, and has four children.  She balances her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She has had her business for some time now and it is going well for her because of the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells different types of products, such as rice and sugar, among others.  She wants to keep working so she can keep helping her family.  

She is requesting this loan to buy oil, milk, and other products. 

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy oil, milk, and other products

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en: Adelyn is 35 years old and lives in Bongabong, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are school age. Adelyn has been engaged in managing a retail store that sells good lumber, firewood and other wood for two years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 per week doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock for her wood retail business. Adelyn has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future Adelyn hopes to expand her business to gain more profits and to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her wood retail business.

location.town: Tangub - Bongabong, Tangub City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA 2008” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Rosa Celia tiene 51 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia vende comida a todos sus clientes que le solictan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tejidos, comida, lubricantes de carros, ropa y otros brindan servicios profesionales.
 Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Las socias que salen adjuntas en la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “FUERZA 2008” from the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

Rosa Celia is 51 years old. She has 4 children and is single. She alternates her daily activities with a restaurant business. She sells food to all of her customers that request it from her. She has worked in this business for a good amount of time. It is going well thanks to the determination that she has put into her business each day. She wishes to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue to support her family.

Rosa Celia is requesting the loan to purchase supplies such as rice, among others.

The other members make livings from selling fabric, food, car lubricants, and clothing, and others provide professional services. The members are thankful to those who form a part of this dream through these means and promise to make their payments in the established timeframe.

The person whose face is covered does not belong to the communal bank.

The members that are added to the photo asked for permission to come late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like rice, among others.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras, esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área y posteriormente mejorar la cantidad de cosecha, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al desarrollo del cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alexander is 28 years old, married, and lives with his children and wife who are his first priority. With his loan he plans to buy fertilizer and fungicide, and to pay for labor to tend to his coffee crops. He also wants to buy some seedlings to plant among his existing plants in order to increase the density of the plants and later on improve the yield of the crop, taking advantage of the fertility of the land, the climate and other conditions that favor the development of coffee growing. 

With these improvements to his crop he hopes to have some profits and thus improve his family's living conditions. He will also invest a little more in his crops and accomplish some other goals. This is the first loan that he is getting from FUDECOSUR. He did not have any loans previously with state banks, but FUDECOSUR made the process much easier and offered much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fungicide, and to pay for labor for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for cheese making such as tools, rennet and other liquids, milk, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
En muchas ocasiones una madre abandona grandes sueños y oportunidades para poder dedicarse a sus hijos impartirles una educación y un estilo de vida justo para que sean personas de bien para la sociedad y en la mayoría de casos tienden a descuidarse y dejar tirado en definitiva esos sueños de grandeza que desde jóvenes tuvieron. 
Mónica quiere recobrar el tiempo perdido y para ello quiere fortalecer su negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, dulces y snaks y añadido quiere comprar un cerdo para engordarlo y venderlo a un mejor precio para ello solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra del cerdo y surtido para su tienda pues quiere crecer tener una mejor vida, comprarse cosas para ella y para sus hijos y recordar siempre que hay un motivo para progresar y ser cada día mejor.
texts.en:
In many cases mothers will abandon their greatest dreams and opportunities to dedicate themselves to their children and offer them an education and a decent lifestyle so they become upstanding people in society.  In the majority of these cases, they tend to neglect themselves and leave the big dreams they've had since childhood cast aside.

Mónica wants to make up for lost time and in order to do that she wants to strengthen her business selling necessity items, candy, and snacks and, in addition, she wants to buy a pig to fatten and sell at a better price.  This is why she is requesting this loan to buy a pig and to stock her business, as she wants to grow and have a better life, be able to buy things for herself and for her children, and remember that there is always a reason to move ahead a better oneself every day.

loans.use: to buy a pig and to buy general necessity grocery items.

loans.name: Los Portales De Pariachi Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Portales De Pariachi” está conformado por 06 socios responsables y solidarios. Este es el caso de Frida de 52 años de edad separada con 01 hijo independiente.  Ella  se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano. Se siente feliz pues a pesar de las competencias Frida ha llegado fidelizar a sus clientes. Su anhelo es contar con una librería. El crédito lo destinará para la compra de embalajes, sobres y bolsas. El grupo “Los Portales De Pariachi” agradece el crédito solicitado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Frida es la tercera del lado derecho y chompa marrón.
texts.en: This is the “Los Portales de Pariachi” group, comprising six responsible and caring members. One of them is 52-year-old Frida, who is separated and has one independent child. She makes a living from transportation services. She is happy because despite the competition Frida has managed to build up a loyal client base. She wishes to have a bookstore. The loan will be used to purchase packaging, envelopes, and bags. The “Los Portales De Pariachi” group is grateful for the loan it requested and is committed to continuing to work well. Frida is the third from the right and is wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use: to buy packaging, envelopes, and bags

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es: Israel Antonio, tiene la edad  de 53 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de mejora en el terreno como lo son terrazas a nivel para evitar que con la lluvias el suelo sufra  erosión y también darle asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo con un buen desarrollo y sanidad  para hacer resiembras, esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Israel Antonio is 53 years old and married. He lives with his children and his wife, who are his greatest priority.
