With the loan he aims to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and pay labourers to help with the coffee crop and make improvements to his plot of land by creating level terraces to prevent the rains eroding the soil. He will also buy some healthy seed starters for replanting, with the goal of increasing plant density and making the most of the good soil fertility, weather conditions, and other conditions that are favourable to coffee growing. With these improvements to the crop, he expects to obtain more profits and thereby improve his family’s living conditions, invest a little more in the land and crops, and accomplish some goals. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not received any loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to make improvements to his coffee crops

loans.name: Genie

texts.es: Genie, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casada, vive con su hijo y esposo, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una máquina para realizar trabajos en soldadura, para la reparación  y fabricación de portones y cercas en metal que se requieren soldar para que tengan un mejor terminado, la cual le facilitará la elaboración de trabajos en metal y así poder aumentar la cantidad de armaduras realizados y aprovechar el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones y poder tener ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de otros equipos necesarios y otras herramientas, y  también lograr un mejor acabado a los trabajos fabricados, además de aumentar la cantidad y calidad de piezas. Con esta compra pretende hacer más diseños, más variados y así cumplir con los pedidos a corto plazo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Genie is 45 years old and married. She lives with her son and husband, who are her greatest priority. With the loan she aims to purchase a soldering machine for repairing and making metal gates and fences, which need soldering so that they have a better finish. This will facilitate the fabrication of metal work and she will thereby be able to increase the quantity of frames built, make the most of the knowledge acquired in her training, and have income to continue investing in the purchase of necessary equipment and other tools. She will also be able to produce a better finish for her works, besides increasing the quantity and quality of the pieces. With this purchase she aims to make more designs that are more varied and thereby have a short turnaround on orders. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not received other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a soldering machine

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es una persona trabajadora de 71 años de edad, Soltero, tiene un hijo varón, quienes viven en el departamento de Sololá. Su actividad principal es la agricultura, se dedica al cultivo maíz, eligieron esta actividad por las condiciones de clima y suelo, lleva veinticinco años en la siembra de hortalizas, experiencias que ha ayudado a manejar bien todo el proceso productivo, además se dedica a la venta de artesanías en los mercados comunitarios, así obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de insumos agrícola, principalmente fertilizante y abono orgánico  para el cultivo de maíz. La meta que tiene es diversificar sus hortalizas y con las ganancias comprar un lote de terreno e incrementar su producción.
texts.en: Juan is a hard-working 71-year-old man. He is single and has a son. They live in the department of Sololá. He works in agriculture, growing maize. He chose this work because of the weather and soil conditions. He has been growing vegetables for 25 years; this experience has helped him to manage the entire production process well. He also sells artisanal products at the markets, which is how he obtains the majority of his earnings for supporting his family. He is requesting a loan of GTQ 3,000.00 in order to purchase farming supplies, namely fertilizer and organic compost for the maize crop. His goal is to diversify his vegetables and, with his profits, to purchase a plot of land and increase his output.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his maize crop

loans.name: Santos Genaro

texts.es: Genaro de 40 años de edad es muy reconocido en su comunidad por ser un hombre honrado y muy trabajador. Él se gana la vida trabajando cuatro días a la semana como jardinero de manera domiciliar. Genaro desea mejorar las paredes de su vivienda colocando un repello y afinado para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar arena, cemento y pagar la mano de obra para que le repellen y afinen las paredes a su vivienda.
texts.en: 40-year-old Genaro is very well-known in his community for being an honourable and very hard-working man. He makes a living by working four days a week as a gardener. Genaro wishes to improve the walls of his house by plastering/rendering them, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI for purchasing sand and cement and paying labourers to render and finish the walls of his home.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement and pay for labourers to plaster/render and finish the walls of his home

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es:
Más de 20 años de experiencia y de oficio lleva la señora Ana en su puesto de venta de comidas rápidas el cual lo inicio sola buscando la manera de obtener recursos para sacar a sus dos hijos adelante, hoy en día ambos mayores de edad pues siempre soñó con verlos convertidos en todos unos profesionales y gracias a su profesión lo logro. 
Se ha trazado una meta de adquirir una casa propia, de realizar un gran esfuerzo de darse un gusto y llegar un día abrir la puerta y entrar al hogar que con tanto esfuerzo quiere conseguir y sabe que tiene el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos.
Solicita un crédito para realizar varios cambios en su local como lo es cambio de cafetera, adquirir una fritadora más potente y comprar insumos para sus comidas
texts.en:
Ana has more than 20 years of experience in her fast food stall, which she began by herself when she was looking for a way to obtain income to support her two children. Now they are both grown up; she always dreamed of seeing them become professionals, and thanks to her work it happened.

She has the goal of having her own house, of making a great effort to give herself the pleasure of one day opening the door and entering the home that she wanted so much. She knows she has the unconditional support of her children.

She is requesting a loan to make several changes to her stall, such as getting a new coffee percolator, getting a more powerful deep-fryer, and buying supplies for making her food.

loans.use: to buy a coffee percolator, a more powerful deep-fryer, and supplies for making her products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and to pay for labor to maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres San Juaneras Group

texts.es: Dúo mujeres San Juaneras doña Claudia de 43 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de producto medicinal y nutricional Omnilife,  en el que ella siguen siendo una de las mayoristas del área de San Juan Sacatepéquez,  ella mantiene en su domicilio producto disponible como también varios días de la semana ofrece apoyo y entrenamiento a nuevas vendedoras de este producto, producto que le ha permitido  crecer y superarse como mujer y como pequeña empresaria, y también le llena de gran alegría ayudar a las personas y ser parte de muchos testimonios bien impactantes para la vida de quien han encontrado una solución de manera natural con estos productos.en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas productos medicinal y nutricional para la venta.
texts.en:
Doña Claudia, age 43, is part of the Dúo Mujeres San Juaneras Group. She sells Omnilife medicinal and nutritional products, and she continues being one of the wholesalers in the San Juan Sacatepéquez area.  

She keeps the products available in her home, and on several days of the week she offers support and training to new salespersons. The products have allowed her to grow and excel as a woman and as a small businesswoman, and it fills her with joy to help people, and to be part of many impressive testimonials about the lives of those who have found a natural solution with these products.  

On this occasion she is requesting a loan in order to purchase more medicinal and nutritional products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase medicinal and nutritional products to sell.

loans.name: Lucia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lucia es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes.
Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del municipio de Bello.
Todos los días trabaja para darle una buena calidad de vida  a sus hijos por los cual aspira a darles un excelente futuro y una calidad de vida mejor.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su actividad.
Con este apoyo podrá aumentar su oferta de productos para continuar trabajando y poder soñar con una mejor vida.
Ellla guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Lucia is a very kind person who always has a surprise for the customers who visit her grocery store.  Thanks to her charisma and good humor, she has won the hearts and recognition of the people in the town of Bello.  She works everyday to provide her children with a good quality of life.  She strives to give them a better quality of life and a great future.

Currently, she is asking for a loan to stock staple products, and in this way, to give a significant boost to her business.  With this support she will be able to extend the product lines she offers in order to keep working and dreaming of a better life.

She maintains the hope of being able to continue her business and so to keep affecting the lives of her customers through her good service.

loans.use: to stock her convenience store

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.en:
Cerilo is 56 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with 3 adult children.

Cerilo is engaged in operating and driving his own trisikad for 6 years already and he earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month from doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing bicycle parts to repair his trisikad. Cerilo has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future,  Cerilo hopes to acquire additional trisikad units to hire.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle parts to repair his trisikad.

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbaatar, 53 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for more than 20 years and accumulated vast experience in picking customers, short-cutting roads and driving smoothly. His wife has retired from work and gets a state pension. 

The house he renovated last year has been deteriorated due to heavy snowball and rainfall. So he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Ocomistu Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OCOMISTU” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de comida, venta de parlantes, compra y venta de ganado, costura de chompas, venta de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una campaña de promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, iniciando con un capital básico y con meriendas pequeñas, con el pasar del tiempo amplio su producción y mejoró su ubicación. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo y verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Ocomistu" will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional Center. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Justina is the president. The businesses that the members of the group run are varied. Among them are selling milk, selling food, selling speakers, buying and selling livestock, making sweaters, and selling potatoes.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Justina is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago, entering at the invitation of a promotional campaign by the institution. She now has a business of selling food. She lets it be known that she began it a number of years ago, beginning with some basic capital and small snacks. With the passing of time, she expanded her production and improved her location. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy rice, oil, pasta, and vegetables wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto, and after preparing the food she will sell it in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has six children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, pasta, and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbaatar, 33 years old, lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2011. His wife is a cook and works at a restaurant. Their sons go to school. 

He is requesting a loan of $2,700 USD to buy four tires for his truck. Due to the mining boom in Mongolia, lots of transportation is ongoing, so he travels many times between districts and depreciates his truck's tires. In order to effectively transport goods, he needs high quality tires, as this business is his family's main income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy four tires

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Agustina works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Agustina is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Agustina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: José Arnoldo

texts.es:
José de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, está soltero y vive con sus tíos. 

José se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y la ganadería, durante años,  ya que ha sido el trabajo familiar y su fuente de ingresos. El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de ganado. Él planea comprar una yunta de bueyes y ampliar su capital para tener una familia con buena manutención y que no les falta nada.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old. He went to school through third grade. He is single and lives with his uncles.

José has worked in agriculture and livestock raising for a number of years, since it has been the family work and his source of income. He will use the loan to buy livestock. He plans to buy a team of bulls and expand his capital in order to have a family with good support that doesn't lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 48 years old and a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Nilda has a general store business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like shampoo, sugar, soap and other groceries.

Nilda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, sugar, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer que logro montar un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar en una sala de su casa y la cual tuvo gran ayuda por parte de su hermano quien le aporto con capital para iniciar su negocio. 
Sandra es madre de una niña de 7 años de edad y a sus 24 años de edad siente que todavía debe permanecer en casa para educarla y acompañarla en su crecimiento por ello la tienda ha sido de gran ayuda pues ayuda a su hija y ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Su mayor dificultad se ha presentado con los clientes que le ofrece crédito y se demora en pagarle por ello en ocasiones se ve limitada para invertir en un mejor surtido para su tiendo razón por la cual solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de la canasta familiar como grano, abarrotes y Snack con lo que podrá seguir teniendo unas ventas regulares y proyectando su negocio a expandirse y convertirlo en algo más grande y rentable
texts.en:
Sandra is a woman who managed to set up a business, a store with products for the basic family market basket, in a room of her house. She had great help on the part of her brother, who supported her with capital to begin her business.

Sandra is the mother of a little girl of 7, and at her age of 24, she feels that she still needs to stay at home to educate her and attend her in her growth. For this, the store has been a great help, since she helps her daughter and helps with the household expenses.

Her great difficulty has been with customers to whom she offers credit and who are late in paying her. Because of that, she is sometimes limited in investing in a better stock for her store, which is the reason why she is applying for a loan to purchase stock of basic family market basket products, such as grains, groceries, and snacks, with which she will be able to continue having regular sales and projecting an expansion of her business and converting it to something bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy a stock of products for the basic family market basket

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a meat shop. Teresita is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: José

texts.es: Juan es una persona trabajadora de 44 años de edad, Casado, tiene seis hijos varones, quien vive en el departamento de Sololá. Su actividad principal es la venta de productos de consumo diario, lleva diez años en el negocio, eligió esta actividad debido al potencial dentro de la comunidad, en su tiempo libre se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas principalmente granos básico como el maíz y frijol, así obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos para el sostenimiento y el bienestar de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para la compra productos de consumo diario e incrementar su inventario de ventas. La meta que tiene es diversificar su tienda para que las personas lo conozcan sobre la calidad del producto que ofrece.
texts.en:
Juan is a hardworking person, age 44.  He is married and has six sons, and he lives in the department of Sololá.  

His main job is selling common products that people use daily.  He has been in this business for ten years; he chose this line of work due to its potential within his community.  In his free time he works raising crops, mainly staples such as corn and beans.  In this way he gets the better part of his income for supporting the wellbeing of his family.  

He is asking for a loan of 5,500 quetzales to buy common products and increase his inventory for sales.  His goal is to diversify his store so that people know it for the quality of products he offers.

loans.use: to buy common products that people use daily

loans.name: Aurora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aurora de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada, su esposo es empleado. Tiene 2 hijos y estudian en la escuela del cantón. 

Aurora tiene 4 años de trabajar como impulsadora de productos. El préstamo lo utilizara para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, como lamina y madera. Ella planea tener una casa en buenas condiciones para que su familia tenga una casa segura.
texts.en:
Aurora, age 37, studied until high school. She is married, her husband is a worker, and she has 2 children who attend to the school of the canton. 

Aurora has worked for 4 years promoting products. The loan will be used to improve the roof of her house with galvanised sheet and wood. She plans to have her house in good conditions so her family can live in a safe place.

loans.use: to improve the roof of her house, with galvanised sheet and wood.

loans.name: Hilda Veronica

texts.es: Hilda de 29 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo artículos de belleza tales como: cremas de manos y cuerpo, lociones, champú, etc. También se dedica a la venta de ropa interior femenina, en su afán por mejorar sus ingresos desea ampliar su pequeño negocio por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar más productos de belleza y ropa interior femenina y así extenderse y llegar a más lugares con sus productos.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 29, lives with her partner and their two children, ages 2 and 7.  She is an enterprising woman who earns her living selling beauty products such as hand and body creams, lotions, shampoo, etc.  She also works selling women’s lingerie.  

In her enthusiasm to improve her earnings, she wants to expand her small business.  Because of this, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy more beauty products and women’s lingerie.  In this way she can spread out and reach more areas with her products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products (hand and body creams, lotions, shampoo, etc.) and women's lingerie

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer, a mill and supplies for his dishes.

loans.name: Dr.ambedkar Group

texts.en:
Dr. Ambedkar Self Help Group (SHG) was formed in June 2014. It consists of 13 rural poor women members who belong to the Below Poverty Line category. This group is located in a remote rural village named Gambhariguda in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. Jayanti, a 36-year-old lady, is one of the members of this group who is sitting with her hand raised. She is a very active and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and four children.

Jayanti has a vegetable cultivation farm. She and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, cucumber, papaya, lady fingers, onions etc on the farm. She sells her products to the traders in the nearest town who come to take vegetables from her farm. Jayanti earns a monthly income of 6,000 INR from this business, which is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses.  Jayanti wants to expand her farming but due to a lack of funds, she is not being able to do that. Therefore, she wants to take a loan of 16,000 INR from Mahashakti Foundation through her SHG. She has planned to use the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides and a diesel pump set for lifting water for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Jayanti dreams of constructing a house and digging a deep bore well for a better irrigation facility for her farm. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work. 

Among the other 12 members,  five are doing vegetable cultivation and vending, one member is doing a cycle store business, four members are doing  a general store business and two members are doing a cloth vending business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides and a diesel pump set for her farm.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from her business is assisting with their everyday household expenditures. Her husband is helping her generate income to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma hopes that her business will last longer and grow bigger as time passes by. She dreams that her family will always stick together. She attends the fellowship* every week for the teachings.  Sharing the word of God continues to enlighten and uplift her spirit and gives her inspiration in her everyday life. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Productoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRODUCTORAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, artesano en instrumentos de cuerdas, venta de pollo, venta de productos de cocina, venta de gelatina y frescos, tejido de mantas, venta de jugos de quinua.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía, ya que le ayudo por varios años, con un poco capital ahorrado emprende su negocio independiente hace dos años atras. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo y verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio médico que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Productoras Communal Bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Verónica's the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including food sales, making stringed instruments, chicken sales, kitchen products sales, gelatin and beverage sales, weaving blankets, and sales of juices made of quinoa.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Verónica.  She said it's the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer who visited her.

Currently Verónica has a business selling food, which she learned from her aunt, whom she helped for several years.  With a little bit of capital she saved, two years ago she started her independent business.

The loan she's going to get is to increase her capital to buy rice, pasta, and vegetables, which she'll get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and, after preparation, sell in her food stall.  This job allows her to generate income to support her family, because she's single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the medical consultations the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es: Verónica de 21 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar. Ella es una joven muy tenaz que se gana la vida como vendedora en una tienda en el mercado central desde hace 2 años. Verónica desea reparar el techo de un cuarto de su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lamina y madera para cambiar el techo de un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Veronica is 21 years old and she lives with her family group. She is a very determined young person. She has made a living selling in a store of the central market for two years now. 

Veronica wants to repair the roof of a room in her home. For this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to buy laminate and wood to replace the roof of a room in her home.

loans.use: to buy laminate and wood to replace the roof of a room in her house.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Ma. Linda has been engaged in a variety store business within her community in Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines for more than 10 years now. She is 51 years of age and blessed with two children. She is already a widow and that’s why she is working hard to provide for her family. Her children are helping her financially.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Ma. Linda wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to take a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. 

Ma. Linda dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Babylou

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Babylou works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of frozen foods business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening and her general store. Babylou is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of frozen foods to sell for her buy and sell of frozen foods business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Babylou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 52 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Hannah works very hard to provide for them.

Hannah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase soft drinks, milk, chips, bread, soft drinks, etc.

Hannah has been in this business for 13 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, milk, chips, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy sugar, milk, coconut etc for her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, coconut etc for her business.,

loans.name: Mary Ermelyn

texts.en:
Mary Ermelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ermelyn is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Mary Ermelyn has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Mary Ermelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Mary Ermelyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mary Ermelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 46 years old and married with four children; one child is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a direct-selling business, selling Avon products in the Philippines. Josefa has been in this business for seven years. 

She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like lotion, powder, and other Avon products to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like lotion, powder, and other Avon products to sell

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo un hombre cuyo empuje y ganas de salir adelante son infranqueables pues este hombre de 55 años de edad en un inicio comenzó con su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas en la ciudad de Cali pero pro problemas de salud decidió desistir del negocio.
Padre de 4 hijos con un feliz matrimonio le ocurrió un acontecimiento particular y es que por lo general los padres transmiten los conocimientos a sus hijos y le enseñan de su profesión pero en esta historia los papeles se invirtieron pues uno de sus hijos al enterarse de las condiciones de su padre opto por traerlo a su ciudad y le enseño la profesión de venta de mercancía para el hogar como sabanas, almohoadas cobertores entre otros con lo que le ha ido muy bien pues trabajo con un empleado distribuyendo su mercancía en varios barrios y ofreciendo sus productos por lo general a crédito por lo que su movimiento de cartera es lento. 
Solicita un crédito para surtirse de mercancía y comprarla al por mayor pues quiero comprar un mejor carro para llegar  más lugares y en el cual quepan más existencias y se ha trazado una meta de 1 año para lograr este cometido.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a man whose push and desire to get ahead are unsurpassed.  This 55-year old man at first started a business selling fast food in Cali.  However, due to health problems, he decided to give up the business. 
But something peculiar happened to this happily married father of four children.  Generally, it is the parents who pass on their knowledge to the children and teach their children their profession.  But in this story, the roles were switched.  One of Gerardo's children, after finding out about his father's condition, decided to bring Gerardo to his city.  He taught his father how to sell household merchandise, like sheets, pillows, quilts and other items.  Business has been going very well for Gerardo.  He works with an employee to distribute the merchandise in various neighborhoods.  He generally sells on credit, and so getting his money is slow.   
Gerardo is requesting a loan to stock up on merchandise and to be able to buy it wholesale.  He wants to buy a better car so he can reach more areas and fit more of his stock in it.  He has given himself the goal of one year to make good on that commitment.

loans.use: to purchase home decorating supplies, such as quilts, sheets, curtains and pillows.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 41 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and also earns an income by direct-selling Avon products.

Lolita has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 56 years old and married, with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

Leonila has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell. Leonila has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Soeurt's Group

texts.en:
Soeurt, a local resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is 53 years old and a mother of four children; two are in school and two are too young for schooling. 

To support her entire family, rice cropping is the main source of income which she has been involved in for 20 years. This is the seventh loan for Soeurt with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and her living condition is getting better than before. Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. For Soeurt, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Nay's Group

texts.en: A local resident from Battambang province Nay is a 47-year-old mother of one kid. She struggles for a living. She grows rice as the main source of income which she has been involved with for 20 years, earning about 43,200 KHR per day. This is the fourth loan for Nay with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has been involved in the current business for ages and it has improved her lifestyle gradually. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She highly hopes that she can make triple income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Titintaya De Huatajata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TITINTAYA DE HUATAJATA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, venta de api, artesanía en lana, venta de freso hervido, venta de pescado, venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio, de forma independiente, hace tres años, con el primer préstamo obtenido por Pro Mujer, ya que aprendió la pesca de su pareja actual.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para mejora de sus herramientas (compra redes para pesca) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de pesca, para poder sacar sus productos a la venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no esta presente una de las socias, ella tenía una reunión en el colegio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Titintaya de Huatajata” is starting its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Victoria is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling fish, selling “api” (a traditional beverage made from corn), making crafts from wool, selling boiled products, selling fish, and selling food.

The loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Victoria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation through a mass promotion held by the organization. Victoria currently has a business in which she sells fish. She has been learning the business since starting it three years ago and works independently. This is the first loan that she has obtained from Pro Mujer. She also learned how to fish from her current partner.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to replace her equipment (fishing nets) that she will acquire from sellers in the city of La Paz and then put to use in the place where she goes fishing so that she can have products to sell. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Victoria is in a common-law relationship and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Victoria said that she enjoys the life insurance offered by the organization. One of the members does not appear in the photo because she had to attend a meeting at her child’s school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Cheat's Group

texts.en: A local resident from Bovel district of Battambang province, Cheat is 56 years old and married. She has three children to support. To overcome her family’s hardship, rice cropping on two hectares of land and a paid working job are the main sources of income, which return her about 20,600 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Cheat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, in a group of four, she is a leader. For Cheat, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy rice seed for her crop. She hopes to gain double income than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and to buy rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Thai's Group

texts.en: Thai, a villager from Bovel district of Battambang province, is 51 years old and a mother of four kids. For her family cassava & soy bean are the main source of income. To supplement her income she works for others for a fee. This is the business that she has had for ages. Thai is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy rice seed. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and to buy rice seed.

loans.name: Thai's Group

texts.en: Thai, a villager from the Bovel district of Battambang province, is 51 years old and a mother of four kids. For her family, cassava and soy beans are the main source of income for her family. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee. This is the business that she has had for ages. Besides the business loan that her team has requested, she and her joint borrower have applied for another consumption loan to be used to support her household. Thai, the group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy household appliances and decent clothes for her kids. She strongly believes that she can provide the necessary materials for her family.

loans.use: To buy household appliances and decent clothes for her kids

loans.name: Mariano Mercedes

texts.es:
El socio Mariano Mercedes se sigue dedicando al negocio de construccion y crianza de cuyes,  el socio los cuyes los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes. El socio solicita le crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los cuyes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mariano Mercedes continues to work in the construction business and raise guinea pigs. After he raises and fattens the guinea pigs, Mariano sells them at different markets. He has been at this business for several years and is doing very well. He dreams of having a place where he can sell the guinea pigs.

Mariano is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs and feed for the animals. He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ella posee un comedor ubicado enfrente de su casa en una zona muy transitada, tiene mucha clientela por los precios accesibles y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra  solventar algunas de las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para ampliar su negocio comprando sillas y mesas, también comprar otras licuadoras para poder vender licuados de fruta   y asi tener junto a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Paula is 50 years old and resides in her own home with her children. She has an eatery that is located in front of her house in a very busy area. Paula has many customers because her prices are affordable and friendly service comes with each sale. With the income she earns from her sales, Paula is able to pay for a few of the household necessities.

She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by purchasing chairs and tables. Paula will also buy some additional blenders for selling fruit smoothies. As a result, she and her children can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and additional blenders.

loans.name: Ron's Group

texts.en: Ron is 51 years old and a resident from Moung Russey district in Battambang province. She has seven children, two of whom are in school. To secure the needs of her household, she grows pineapple as the main source of income, a business in which she has been occupied for ages. Now, she joined a group of four to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her pineapple. She strongly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her pineapple farm

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
A rice and sesame farmer residing in Battambang province, Vanny is 33 years old and blessed with three children — one schoolchild and one under-school-aged child. The 13 years involvement in her current business earns her about 31,700 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Vanny, a former borrower who used the past two loans with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment, is now living in better conditions. For this loan cycle, she forms a group of three to get a new loan.  As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en: Sokchea, a resident from Kampong Cham province, is married and has two children. She tackles her daily source of income via rice farming and fish catching. Sokchea has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she forms a group of four to get a new loan.  As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed for replanting. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed for replanting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ory's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Ory is 32 years old and married. She has five children. For her family, rice cropping and fish catching for resale are the main sources of income for her household. This business has returned her about 37,800 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. As a first-time borrower, Ory forms a group of six to get the loan from VisionFund. As a group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice crop. She hopes to gain a better yield from her crop than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Idalia Oneyda

texts.es: Idalia tiene la edad de 32 años trabaja para el sector privado, con su marido han luchado para darle lo mejor a sus dos pequeños hijos que están en edad escolar, ella es una señora con mucho deseo de superar y necesita coronar su carrera de Administración de Empresas por lo que solicita el crédito para pagar Curso de Titulación y así contar con mayor soporte Profesional que será de mucha importancia en el ámbito laboral y Social. A pesar que su esposo le ayuda económicamente en los gastos del hogar no se puede proponer inversiones con un solo desembolso por lo que tiene que ir poco a poco mejorando su calidad de vida a base de préstamos ya que los ingresos están presupuestados para pagos de cuotas accesibles y no con monto mayores, una vez que cancele necesitara otro crédito para invertirlo en mantenimiento de Moto Taxi del Esposo que es su fuente de ingresos y a veces los días son malos al no encontrar pasajeros que requieran del servicio y esto no le permite recaudar monto suficiente para el mantenimiento por lo que desde ya tiene previsto solicitar su futuro crédito.  Expresa estar muy agradecida con Afodenic y Kiva por la oportunidad del Financiamiento que es una opción de alcanzar sus objetivos proyectados.
texts.en:
Idalia is 32 years old and works in the private sector. She and her husband are striving to provide the best for their two young children who are of school age. Idalia is a woman who has tremendous drive to succeed, so she needs to complete her degree in Business Administration. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can pay for a degree course. Having higher professional credentials will be very important in her work and social environments.

Even though her husband helps financially with the household expenses, they are not able to pay for this investment in a lump sum. Therefore, they have gradually improved their quality of life with the help of loans. With the income she and her husband have budgeted, Idalia is able to afford the loan payments since she cannot take out any higher amounts. Once this loan is paid off, she will need to request another loan to invest in the maintenance of her husband’s motorcycle taxi that serves as a source of income. On some days it does not function properly, so he is not able to carry passengers who are in need of his services. Her husband is not able to set aside enough money for the maintenance, so they have already settled on applying for a future loan.

Idalia expresses her great appreciation to AFODENIC and Kiva for this financing opportunity since it allows her to accomplish the goals she has set for herself.

loans.use: to pay her tuition expenses.

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en: Phen is a citizen from Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She grows rice and weaves Krama (scarf-like garment) as the main sources of income. She has been involved in the current business for ages, and it earns her about 30,000 KHR (Cambodian riels). Phen has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She forms a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Thou's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Kampong Cham province, Thou is 39 years old and married. To secure the needs in her family, she does rice cropping and has a paid working job as the main sources of income. This business earns her about 44,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the first loan for Thou with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash and to pay for labor costs. She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay for labor costs

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a tailor shop. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be capital. 

She will use the 25,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase two sewing machines. Her business goal is to own a tailoring school within five years. She hopes that in the future, she may use the profits from her business to pay her children's school fees.  She would also like to buy a plot of land and build. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines

loans.name: Domnic

texts.en:
Domnic is a 45-year-old married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a motorcycle service. He has been involved in this business for four years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be capital. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase a welding machine and expand his garage. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within five years. He hopes that in the future, he may use the profits from his expanded business to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine and expand his garage

loans.name: Sean's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham, Sean is 58 years old and a mother of one child. She deals with her daily cost of living with rice farming and Krama Weaving. This business generates about 31,100 KHR per day for her. Sean is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She teamed up with a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Laut

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Laut is 32 years old and married. She has three kids who still rely on her. For her family, rice cropping, a grocery-selling business, and her paid working job are the main sources of income. She has been involved in the current business for 13 years. 

This is the first loan for Laut with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pay for weeding fees, and to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for weeding fees and to buy more grocery items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a 56-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothing and shoes. She has been involved in this business for one year. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of proper premises. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional stock to increase inventory and expand her business. Her business goal is to grow into a larger clothing store within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business may grow bigger, and that she may generate wealth to improve the standard of living for her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to increase inventory and expand her business.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a general store where he sells tea, sugar, cooking fat, salt, etc. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional stock. His business goal is to own a wholesale operation within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his general store

loans.name: Wilmer Efren

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive don Wilmer, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 12, 8  y 6 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su mujer es cajera. 
El señor Wilmer es un hombre muy trabajador que a base de su esfuerzo le gusta sacar adelante a su familia, el trabaja en una distribuidora de productos plásticos de lunes a viernes, pero en sus ratos libres vende estos productos plásticos que compra más barato, recorrer la ciudad y sitios cercanos vendiendo fundas plásticas, tarinas, platos, cucharas, etc. así el se gana algo extra ya que su sueldo no le alcanza para sacar adelante  a su familia, ya son 6 años que lleva con su  negocio con el cual salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio va a comprar fundas plásticas, tarinas, platos, cucharas, entre otras cosas de plástico. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 5 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In San Ignacio, which is located in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the September 3rd Communal Bank meet every 15 days. Portoviejo is a place known for its hardworking people who dedicate themselves to agriculture and raising livestock.

Don Wilmer lives in this place. He is 30 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 12, 8, and 6) who are in either high school or elementary school. His wife is a cashier.

Sr. Wilmer is a hardworking man who enjoys putting in the effort to help his family get ahead. He works Monday through Friday at a distribution center that sells plastic goods. In his free time, he also sells plastic goods since he can get them at a much cheaper price. He travels throughout the city and places nearby in order to sell plastic cases, serving platters, plates, spoons, and other products. This allows him to earn some extra income since his salary is not enough to help his family move forward. Wilmer has already been in this business for six years and he has been able to get ahead.

This loan will be used to restock his business with more inventory. He will buy plastic cases, serving platters, plates, spoons, and other products. Wilmer has been with the Communal Bank for five loan cycles and enjoys being a member because the loans have been of great help. His dreams include providing the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy plastic cases, serving platters, plates, spoons, and other products.

loans.name: Violeta Lelis

texts.es:
Violeta Lelis tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Chachapoyas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Chachapoyas, ubicada en la Selva norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, los alimenta con granos naturales de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 200 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos pequeños y aves de corral para engordarlo y ofrecerlo a sus clientes a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Violeta Lelis is 59 years old and lives in the District of Chachapoyas. This community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Chachapoyas Province, which is part of the region of Chachapoyas in the northern jungles of Peru.

Violeta raises and sells small animals in an area behind her home. The animals feed off of natural grains that are produced in the area. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,200 PEN so that she can buy piglets and poultry that she can fatten and offer to her customers at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy piglets and poultry.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Alma has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her business.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLTAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tenis, venta de ropa, venta de artículos varios, venta de artículos deportivos, tejido de chompas, costura de abrigos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de tenis; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace tres años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres que tenían el mismo negocio, cuando tuvo su hijo decide independizarse y tener su negocio independientemente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tenis por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Estrellitas” (Little Stars) is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Sandra is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling tennis shoes, selling clothes, selling a variety of merchandise, selling sports equipment, knitting sweaters, and producing coats.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Sandra. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from of a promoter of the organization who visited her at her house. Sandra currently has a business of selling tennis shoes. She has gained knowledge of this business since she started it three years ago. Sandra learned the trade from her parents who were in the same line of work. After she had a child, she decided to become independent and start her own business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying tennis shoes in bulk. She acquires her products from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and then sells them from her vending stall. Working in his manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Sandra is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sandra said that she enjoys the training seminars and the health services offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Yohelis

texts.es: Ana quiere mejorar su negocio aumentando sus ventas y sus utilidades y está aplicando a un credikiva, con un primer financiamiento dirigido a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Ella posee un negocio de venta de mercancía variada desde hace 2 años, cuando entusiasmada por su prima decidió emprender una aventura comercial, para apoyar su hogar con nuevos ingresos, debido a que estaba toda la carga de sus gastos en cabeza de su cónyuge y entre los dos tiene grandes sueños para sus dos hijos en las edades de2 y 7 años. Los productos de la oferta de Ana son las cremas, colonias, perfumes y además galletería, dulcería y artículos ara el hogar, los cuales compra directamente a 3 empresas multinacionales que le otorgan una guía especialidad para productos, mediante las cuales realizar la promoción de cada articulo.  Su meta mas adelante es dar apertura a una miscelánea y remodelar su vivienda, pero su mayor desafío es fidelizar sus clientes, para incrementar sus ventas y lograr tener ahorros. Con su credikiva comprará mercancías variadas, como cosméticos, ropa interior y artículos para el hogar, con ello empezará el camino hacia el logro de sus metas.
texts.en:
Ana wants to improve her business by increasing her sales and her profits. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Ana has a business in which she has been selling various merchandise for the past two years. After receiving encouragement from her cousin, Ana decided to start a commercial venture so that she could have income for contributing to the household expenses since her husband had full responsibility on his shoulders at the time. Both of them have huge ambitions for their two children, ages 2 and 7.

The products that Ana offers include crèmes, colognes, and perfumes. She also sells cookies, candy, and household goods. Ana buys directly from three multi-national companies that issue specialty catalogs for their products, which is how the goods are promoted. Her goals going forward are to open a variety store and to remodel her home. However, her greatest challenge is building customer loyalty so that she can increase her sales and be able to save some money.

With her Kiva loan, Ana will buy a variety of merchandise such as cosmetics, undergarments, and household goods. This will help her to start down the path of achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, undergarments, and household goods to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. Beatriz is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more material for her business.

Beatriz has been in this business for 5 years now.

Beatriz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more material for her business.

loans.name: Wihembe Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Vincent is a 38-year-old Ugandan, married, with four children who attend school under his care. His business is agriculture but he also rides a boda boda to supplement his income. He has been doing this since 2005.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from UGAFODE through Wihembe group to buy corn and beans which are buying cheaply, this being harvest season. He will be able to make profit after sales.

His plan for the future is to complete his commercial building at the nearby trading centre and also educate his children. He hopes with continuous financial boosts, the challenge of limited capital to him and the group members will be history. He is a hard working man.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Perla is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Perla has a buy and sell ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. Perla requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothes to sell to her customers.

Perla has been in this business for 4 years. In the future Perla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a general store where she sells a variety of goods. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to expand and be successful within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 48 years old and married with four children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Nenita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Eliecer Enrique

texts.es:
Trabajos y perseverante, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Eliecer, un hombre trabajador y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
El desea iniciar un negocio que le permita estar más pendiente de su familia y que le genere unos ingresos más estables. Quiere montar un negocio de cría de cerdos de levante.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican.
El posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño capital para comenzar con este proyecto, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y de concentrados.
Con este préstamo podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y que esta actividad se convierta en su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Work and perseverence are two words that perfectly describe Eliecer.  He is a hard-wroking family man who does everything he can to give his wife and children a better quality of life.

He wants to start a business that will allow him to be closer to his family and generate a more stable income.  The busines he wants to go into is pig raising.  This is the most common business activity in the region and many local people are involved in it.

Eliecer has a broad knowledge of the matter and believes that he only needs a little capital to begin his project.  Therefore, he is requesting economic help to invest in buying pigs and animal feed.

Through the loan he will be able to realize his dream of becoming independent and making this business his main source of income.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed to start a business.

loans.name: Eliana Virginia

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Eliana, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 7 años que estudia en  escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Eliana es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas, edredones, ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana unas dos a tres horas al día ya que es un trabajo que no tiene horario fijo, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien,  sus ventas las realiza muy rápido ya que cuenta con buena clientela.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Este es su segundo ciclo en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
En la foto esta la socia con su sobrina.
texts.en:
In San Ignacio, which is located in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the September 3rd Communal Bank meet every 15 days. Portoviejo is a place known for its hardworking people who dedicate themselves to agriculture and raising livestock.

Sra. Eliana lives in this place. She is 25 years old, married, and has a seven-year-old son who is in school. Her husband is a farmer.

Doña Eliana is a housewife who generates her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells bed sheets, bedspreads, clothes of all types, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works three or four days a week for about two to three hours each day. Eliana does not work on a set schedule. She offers her products on credit and collects payment every eight days. Eliana has been in this business for six years and is doing very well. She is able to make sales very quickly since she has a good clientele.

This loan will be used to buy bed sheets, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothes. This is her second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she enjoys being a member because the payment terms are easy to follow. Her dreams include owning a boutique. In the photo, Eliana appears with her niece.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo de 28 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 2 años y medio de edad. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que se gana la vida de pescando tres días por semana, los días restantes los invierte en el cuido y recolección de sus cultivos de plátano, además tiene cultivo de maíz que esta próximo a cosechar. Eduardo desea cambiar el techo de toda su vivienda ya que esta deteriorado como puede observarse en la fotografía por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar lámina galvanizada, clavos, alambre y madera para poder proteger sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 28 years old and lives with his life companion and their son who is 2½ years old. He is a hardworking man who earns his living as a fisherman three day a week. On the other days, he is maintaining his banana crops and gathering the fruit. In addition, he has a crop of corn that will be harvested soon.

Eduardo wants to replace the roof over his entire house since it has deteriorated, as shown in the photo. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy galvanized sheets, nails, wire, and wood so that he can protect the few belongings that he has.

loans.use: to buy construction materials so that he can replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Ercilia Edis

texts.es:
Ercila de 57 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar,  ya que los padres no tenían como ponerla a la escuela.  Esta acompañada el esposo se dedica a la agricultura en esta relación Ercila ha procreado 9 hijos los cuales solo una está en la escuela los otros están en hogares apartes.  Ercila vive con el esposo y una hija y dos nietos.

Ercila se dedica a la agricultura desde que se acompañó hace 39 años, que ella le ayuda al esposo a los cultivos y así han sacado adelante a los hijos. Ella decidió dedicarse a esto porque no había otra fuente de ingreso que entrara a la familia. La milpa le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos y viaja a pie en este trabajo le ayuda el esposo y un hijo en un horario de las 6:00 am a las 11:00 am
     
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 6 sacos de abono y la semilla para sembrar el maíz.

Los sueños Ercila son  que Dios siempre le de vida y que este alentada para seguir ayudándole al esposo al cultivo del maíz que de eso espera que le de ganancias para pagar las deudas que tiene.
texts.en:
Ercila, 57, was unable to get an education because her parents could not afford to send her to school.  She is married and her husband works in agriculture.  They have nine children, one of whom attends school and the rest are in their own homes.  Ercila lives with her husband, a daughter and two grandchildren.

Ercila has worked in agriculture since she married 39 years ago, helping her husband with the crops and providing for their children.  She decided to go into this business because there was no other source of income for the family.  The sorghum crop is about a 15 minute walk from home.  Her husband and a son help and have a work schedule from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan she is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy six sacks of compost and seeds to plant corn. 

Ercila's dream is that Give her a long life to continue helping her husband with the corn crop to earn enough profit to pay off the debt they have.

loans.use: To buy six sacks of compost and seeds to plant corn.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 45 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 9 años de edad.
