Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida de diferentes maneras  tales como elaboración y venta de adornos de caracol y rompe vientos, también elabora dulces de feria como: conserva de coco y de leche, dulce de chilacayote, etc. además hace limpieza en un rancho cercano. Isabel desea ampliar su pequeño negocio elaborando más producto para tener más clientes y distribuir al por  mayor por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar productos para elaborar dulces de feria como: chilacayote , atado de dulce, leche, papaya y coco.
texts.en:
Isabel, 45, lives with her common-law husband and their two children, ages 15 and 9.  She is an enterprising woman who earns a living different ways, such as making and selling snail ornaments and windbreakers.  She also makes sweets for fairs such as coconut and milk preserves, gourd sweets, etc.  She also cleans a nearby ranch.

Isabel wants to expand her small business and make more products to attract more customers, as well as sell wholesale.  She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy products to make fair sweets such as gourd, milk, papaya, coconut and sugar cane.

loans.use: To buy products to make sweets for the fair such as gourds, milk, papaya, coconut, and sugar cane.

loans.name: Romilia Esmeralda

texts.es: Romilia de 26 años de edad  es una mujer luchadora que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado mantener su pequeño negocio de venta de productos varios en su domicilio. Ella desea ampliar  este negocio y aprovechar así su ubicación ya que se encuentra a un costado de la cancha de su municipio por lo que su visión es invertir en más diversidad de productos para ampliar su clientela por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar  productos como: golosinas, detergente, aceite, pan dulce, etc. y de más productos solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Romilia is 26 years old. She is a determined woman who, thanks to her effort and tenacity, has maintained her small business selling various products from home. 

She wants to expand the business and take advantage of its location as it is on one side of the municipality's sports court. Her vision is to invest in a wider range of products to expand her number of customers. She is therefore asking FUSAI for a loan to buy products such as sweets, detergent, oil, sweet bread and more products requested by her customers.

loans.use: to buy sweets, detergents, oil, sweet bread etc

loans.name: Virginia Maribel

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito 3 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Virginia, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 1 años de edad,   el mayor  estudia en jardín de infantes. El marido es chofer. 
Doña Virginia es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y otros productos de catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale casi  todos los días a  recorrer la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos,  aunque también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 4 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
In San Ignacio, which is located in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the September 3rd Communal Bank meet every 15 days. Portoviejo is a place known for its hardworking people who dedicate themselves to agriculture and raising livestock.

Sra. Virginia lives in this place. She is 23 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 4 and 1). Her older child is in pre-school and her husband is a chauffeur.

Doña Virginia is a housewife who generates her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells all types of clothes, shoes, and other products through catalogs. Her sales are conducted by going door-to-door. Almost every day, she travels throughout the city in order to offer her products. She also sells from her home whenever customers come over to buy something that they need. Virginia offers her products on credit and collects payments every week. She has been in this business for more than four years and is doing very well.

This loan will be used to buy clothes and shoes. Virginia has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because one of the loans was used to start her business. Her dreams include owning a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Pocitos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “POCITOS” iniciará el vigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas de vicuña, taller de cerrajería, taller de chapería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido de mantas de alpaca; da a conocer que la técnica de tejido lo aprendió de su madre hace varios años, desde entonces decide emprender este negocio con un capital reducido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Pocitos” is starting its 20th loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Teodora serves as the secretary. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as weaving blankets, managing a neighborhood store, knitting blankets out of vicuña wool, operating a locksmith shop, and operating an auto body shop.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Teodora. She says that she joined Pro Mujer nine years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend at the organization who visited her at her house. Teodora currently has a business in which she weaves blankets out of alpaca wool. She learned her weaving techniques from her mother several years ago. Since then, she decided to start her own business with a small amount of capital.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool in bulk. She acquires her supplies at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then uses them to make the products that she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Teodora is in a common-law relationship and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Teodora said that she enjoys the health services offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Madre Selva Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MADRE SELVA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Calixta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, servicio de comida, ayudantes de albañil, venta de dulces, venta de repuestos de autos, confección de deportivos, taller de costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Calixta es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó al observar que es un servicio que solicitan ampliamente las personas. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en un colegio cercano a su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación y de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "MADRE SELVA" is beginning its first Pro Mujer loan cycle at the Santiago II social center.  The group comprises eight members and its board of directors is led by Calixta, the president.  The businesses the members are involved in are diverse and include food service and sales, bricklayer assistant, sweets sales, auto parts sales, sporting goods and a sewing workshop.

The loan the group is requesting will benefit small business owners, including Calixta.  This is her first experience in Pro Mujer and she joined by invitation through a representative of the institution who visited her.  Calixta currently runs a food business.  She says she started the business because it is something people request many times.

Calixta will use the loan to buy wholesale pasta and rice from distributors which she will sell to a school nearby her home.  This way of working allows her to generate an income to help her family economically.  She is married and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the training and health areas offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy wholesale pasta and rice.

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es: Candelario de 55 años de edad vive con sus 2 hijos de 19 años y  22 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que ha montado su propia carpintería donde elabora muebles de madera como: roperos, juegos de comedor, camas, etc. desde hace 20 años lo que le permite mantener el gasto familiar junto a su hijo el cual trabaja como jornalero. Candelario desea mejorar las paredes de su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena y pagará mano de obra para que le repelle las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Candelario, 55, lives wtih his two children, ages 19 and 22.  He is an entrepreneur who has set up his own carpentry shop where he makes wood furniture such as wardrobes, dining room suites, beds, etc.  He has been in business for 20 years which has allowed him to cover household expenses together with the help of his son who is a day laborer.

Candelario wants to renovate his house and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement and sand, and hire labor to put up drywall.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand, and to hire labor to drywall his house.

loans.name: Maria Lydia

texts.es: Lydia de 55 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar. Desde hace 15 años es propietaria de una tienda ubicada en su domicilio en la que vende productos como: arroz, frijol, papel higiénico, maíz, etc. Dicho negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Lydia desea mejorar las paredes de su vivienda pues como se observa en la fotografía no se encuentran repelladas por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar cemento y arena, además pagará mano de obra para que le repelle su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lydia, 55, lives with her family.  For 15 years she has been running a store from home where she sells products such as rice, beans, toilet tissue, corn, etc.  The business has allowed her to provide for her children since it is her main source of income.

Lydia wants to put up drywall in her house, since as seen in the photograph the walls are bare.  She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement and sand, and to hire labor to put up the drywall.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand, and hire labor to drywall her house.

loans.name: Tripti

texts.en:
Tripti is a 44-year-old rural housewife. She lives in a remote region of Debinagar in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband Kamal and a young son who attends school.  She studied up to grade eight but the poor economic resources of her parents did not provide her with further education. Their only son is in grade nine.

Tripti's husband is 49 years old. He has a small grocery shop adjacent to their house, which is the only source of income for their family. He sells daily necessities like sugar, rice, flour, biscuits, bread, eggs etc.  At first, his business was not going well, but now he is able to turn the tide in his favor and is making good sales these days.  He wants to take advantage of his good fortune.  He would like to stock his shop with varieties to extend a better service to his customers as well as to strengthen the family economy.

Very recently, Tripti applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to restock the store with more grocery items to fulfill the customers' demands so that she will retain and encourage more customers.  She hopes the loan will generate more income and make her dreams come true.

She wants her son to get a higher education in order to establish himself and provide a secure future for the family.

She is very much happy after getting the loan and gives thanks to her generous lenders for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for their existing grocery store.

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Renuka hails from Maynaguri. She is 44 years old and married.  Her family comprises five members: she, her husband and their three children.  All of her children are students. Two of them are in grade seven and grade eight and the third one is in college.  Renuka continued her study until grade seven and due to her parent's lack of funds, she had to give up.  Now she is a homemaker who looks after her husband and family and does all the household jobs.

Renuka's husband Narayan, 47 years old, is a farmer by profession. He is doing vegetable cultivation on his own farmland. He has been engaged in this business for many years and started with vegetables like tomatoes and potatoes.  He has developed a very good relationship with his customers in the village, as he sells fresh, high quality vegetables.

Now he has a new idea of doing paddy cultivation, which is a profitable crop, in order to grow his business and attract more customers as well as provide financial sustenance to his family.

So Renuka wants to help her husband fulfill his wish.  She heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and asked for a loan from them to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers and other materials to start cultivation as soon as possible. She hopes with this loan she will be able to grow better quality paddy and sell it in the market. She dreams of giving a better quality lifestyle with food, education and health to their children.

Her earnest and heartiest thanks go to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Rupali

texts.en:
Rupali is a very young and energetic entrepreneur from Maynaguri.  She is only 23 years old and married with two lovely daughters.  Her daughters are too young for school.  She attended school until the seventh standard and then got married.  She lives in the countryside far from a major city with her husband and daughters.  They have a mud, bamboo and straw made house that lacks the basic facilities like water, electricity etc.

Rupali's husband Biplab, 24 years old, works on his farmland and grows seasonable vegetables.  But his income is so scant that it is hardly sufficient for their family's basic needs.  So for the last five years, Rupali has been engaged in a cattle breeding business.  She has extensive experience in the field of animal husbandry.  Her father used to be involved in the same activity. Initially, she started the business with one dairy cow and sold the cow milk in her neighborhood, whose residents are her main clients.  

Now, with her own efforts, she has established her own business. Now she wants to grow her business. For this reason, she has turned to BJS and asked for a loan from them.  She plans to buy one more dairy cow to improve her milk supply business. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately generate more income for her.  With the profit, she wants to reach her goal of providing a better education to her daughters.

She greatly appreciates the financial help of her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Blanca Marisol

texts.es: Blanca de 41 años de edad vive con su esposo y dos hijos ya mayores uno de ellos acompañado el cual tiene un hijo, además vive con ellos la madre del niño. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos y cuida a su nieto, su esposo, su nuera y sus hijos aportan a la economía familiar por medio de sus trabajos. Blanca desea reparar la cocina y el baño de su vivienda pues como se observa en la fotografía se encuentra en muy malas condiciones por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento y arena para reparar la cocina y el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en: Blanca is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two grown children. One of her children is in a relationship and has a child, and the child's mother lives with them too. Blanca is a hardworking woman who provides domestic services and cares for her grandchild, her husband, her daughter-in-law and her children; they provide the family budget by means of their jobs. Blanca wants to repair the kitchen and the bathroom of her home; as you can see in the photograph they are in very bad condition. She is therefore asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement and sand to repair the kitchen and the bathroom of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to repair the kitchen and the bathroom of her home

loans.name: Hermanos Dom Group

texts.es: Marcos, tiene 38 años de edad, esta soltero vive con sus padres y hermanos en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá.  Marcos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz, frijol y papas. La mayor producción es de papas y la vende en la misma zona. Esta solicitando un segundo ciclo de préstamo por 12,000 lempiras en forma grupal para comprar abono para la siembra de papa. Su objetivo es darle mejor asistencia y obtener mayor producción y más ganancias. El grupo se llama Hermanos Dom y lo integran 5 miembros, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura, quienes solicitan un préstamo grupal por 52,500 lempiras para comprar abonos para el cultivo de papas. En la foto se identifican a la izquierda esta  Pedro, Marcos de camiseta color naranja rayada y Gilberto a la derecha, sentados esta Santos y Jesús a la derecha.
texts.en:
Marcos is 38 years old and single. He lives with his parents and siblings in a village in the municipality of Intibucá.  Marcos has always made a living in agriculture, growing corn, beans and potatoes. His biggest production is potatoes and he sells them in his area. He is asking for a second cycle of a loan for 12,000 Honduran lempiras as a group in order to buy fertilizer to plant potatoes. His objective is to give the crop more assistance and to obtain a greater production and more earnings. 

His group is called "Hermanos Dom" ("Dom Brothers") and has five members who live in the same community and make a living in agriculture. They are requesting a group loan of 52,500 lempiras to buy fertilizer to grow potatoes. In the photo, Pedro is on the left, Marcos is in an orange striped shirt and Gilberto is on the right. Sitting down are Santos and Jesús on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow potatoes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 48 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en el Municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa, Peña Blanca,.
Doña Margarita tiene un negocio de venta de verduras, frutas, leña, adicional vende productos por catalogo y novedades.  Lleva varios años con el negocio donde ha podido ayudar a su familia.
Ella esta solicitando el tercer ciclo de préstamo de 25,000 lempiras para comprar verduras como, repollo, tomate, papas, plátanos, cebolla, bananos y con otra parte va comprar  novedades para ofrecer a los clientes.
Su sueño es trabajar en su negocio, poder aumentar el inventario, ventas y ganancias y  mejorar la calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is 48 years old. She is in a common law marriage with her spouse and they have 3 children. She lives in the town of San Francisco de Yojoa, Peña Blanca.

Margarita has a business selling fruit, vegetables, and firewood. She also sells products via catalog and novelty items. She has had the business for several years now and has been able to help her family.

She is asking for a a loan of 25,000 lempiras in her third cycle to buy vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, plantains, onions, and bananas. another part of it will be used to buy novelty items to offer her customers. Her dream is to work in her business, to be able to increase her inventory, sales and earnings, and to improve the quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, plantains, onions, and bananas. Another part of the loan will be used to buy novelty items to offer her customers.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
María Josefa, tiene 70 años de edad,  es casada, tiene 5 hijos que ya son mayores y trabajan, vive con su esposo en una aldea del Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña María Josefa , cuenta con una fuente de ingreso que es un negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como,  harina, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, medicinas, golosinas, productos de abarrotería, además vende refrescos Big cola al por mayor. Ella esta solicitando el cuarto ciclo de préstamo a ODEF por 20,000 lempiras para comprar mas productos para mantener surtido el negocio como manteca, arroz, frijoles, harina, embutidos, lácteos, productos de limpieza y refrescos Para cumplir con la demanda de los clientes.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio con un incremento en las ventas para obtener mas ingresos  y  lograr tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
María Josefa is 70 years old. She is married and has 5 children who are adults and who work. She lives with her husband in a town in the municipality of  Choloma, Cortes.

María Josefa has a source of income, which is a small store where she sells food products such as flour, beans, rice, sugar, lard, medicines, snacks, and grocery items. She also sells Big beverages wholesale. She is asking for her fourth cycle loan from ODEF for 20,000 lempiras to buy more products to keep her business stocked, such as lard, rice, beans, flour, deli meats, dairy products, cleaning products, and beverages to meet the demand of the customers. 

Her goal is to maintain her business with an increase in sales to obtain more income and be able to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more products such as lard, rice, beans, flour, deli meats, dairy products,  cleaning products, and beverages to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and iron, and also to pay the labor to do the improvements

loans.name: Suleyma De Los Angeles

texts.es: Suleyma de 24 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de un año de edad. Ella es una mujer muy tenaz que se gana la vida vendiendo productos de primera necesidad tales como: detergente, arroz, frijoles, golosinas, azúcar, etc. La tienda la tiene en su domicilio desde hace 5 años. Suleyma desea mejorar el piso de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar arena y cemento además pagará mano de obra para que le arreglen el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Suleyma is 24 years old. She lives with her life's companion and her one year old daughter. She is a very tenacious woman who earns a living selling staple products such as detergent, rice, beans, snacks, sugar, etc. She has had the store in her house for 5 years. Suleyma wants to improve the floor in her house and that is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy sand and cement. She will also pay for the labor costs to fix the floor in her house.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to put in a floor in her house.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es: Don Erasmo, tiene 74 años de edad, es soltero por viudez, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. El siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Su actividad de negocio es la venta de nieves (hielo molido con jugo, miel o leche condensada) estos helados los vende de manera ambulante movilizándose en una carretilla. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener su negocio, actualmente solicita otro ciclo y es por 4,000 Lempiras, para comprar hielo, miel, color, leche, azúcar, vasos y otros insumos que necesite para elaborar las nieves, también va pintar la carretilla. Su objetivo es incrementar las ventas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Erasmo is 74 years old, is a widower, and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. He has always made a living in commerce. His business is the sale of snow cones (shaved ice with juice, honey or condensed milk). He sells these ices in an itinerant fashion, moving along with a pushcart. He has requested a number of loans to maintain his business; currently he his asking for another cycle for 4,000 Honduran Lempiras to buy ice, honey, coloring, milk, sugar, cups and other supplies he needs to make the snow cones. He is also going to paint the pushcart. His objective is to increase his sales to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ice, honey, coloring, milk, sugar, cups and other supplies he needs to make the snow cones, and to paint the pushcart he uses to sell ices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, galvanized sheet metal and brick, and to pay the labor to do improvements on her home

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 34 years old and has five children. Virgie is married and three of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, where she fattens pigs. Virgie requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virgie has been fattening pigs for 7 years now, and she has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virgie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 38 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lenie is borrowing 19000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lenie has been raising pigs for seven years, and she earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling clothes in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Rosemarie is borrowing 13000 PHP through NWTF to buy more blouses, shorts, t-shirts, and other items to sell.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, shorts, t-shirts, and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick, sand, gravel, cement and iron, and also to pay for hand labor to build the bathroom, sink and washroom of her house.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support her family. Roselyn is married and has a direct selling Avon, MSE and Sundance products business in the Philippines.

Roselyn requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon, MSE and Sundance like shoes, lipstick, bags, lotion, etc. to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

Roselyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon, MSE and Sundance like shoes, lipstick, bags, lotion, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sadhana

texts.en:
Sadhana is a loving and hardworking mother of three sons. She is 48 years old and studied still grade 6. She lives with her three sons and husband, Pradeep, 54 years old, in the small village Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have a kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made). Sadhana's husband attended school up to grade 6. He is a car driver and by doing this he earns for the family. Due to poverty they could not provide better education to their sons and now they are grown up and work as laborers on daily wages.

Sadhana always prioritizes her children's future, which is why she has not gotten tired of doing things to give them a better way of life. Sadhana has her grocery store within the locality, where biscuits, bread, butter, spices, flour and other kinds of grocery items are sold. She has chosen this business as there is no other grocery store in her locality.

Now she aims to improve her grocery shop due to the increasing demands of her customers. But to expand her business, she needs capital. So she applied for a loan from BJS to buy grocery items to meet the demands of her customers and at the same time, improve her financial stability and impart a decent life to her family.

She wants to save money from the profit generated from her business and aspires to purchase a car of own in the future.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase items for her grocery shop.
